loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Elena de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una panadería y vende cosméticos desde hace 9 años. Ella inicio el negocio con una arroba de harina en la actualidad ella realiza un quintal de harina tres veces a la semana.
Con el crédito Gloria comprar harina, levadura, azúcar…etc. con el firme propósito de salir adelante.
texts.en: Gloria Elena, 27, is a very hardworking, enterprising woman.  She has had a bakery and has sold cosmetics for the last 9 years.  She started the business with just one arroba [unit of weight] of flour and at present she consumes a quintal of flour three times a week.  Gloria will use the loan to buy flour, yeast, sugar, etc. with the firm goal of getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rubia Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora Rubia es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, viven por el cantón Gualaceo. Este cantón es muy visitado por su armonía, el encanto y la calidez de una ciudad antigua y moderna, tiene una gastronomía muy variada, su gente no pierden sus tradiciones, se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías y lo más importante son personas cálidas y amables.

La Señora Rubia tiene 56 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando. 

Doña Rubia labora en la preparación y venta de comida, labor que realiza hace un año, trabaja sin un horario fijo de domingo a domingo. 

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas. 

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubia is a member of the “Gualaceñitas” communal bank; they live in Gualaceo Canton.  This canton is much visited because of its harmony, charm and warmth of a city that is both ancient and modern.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents keep their traditions.  They make crafts but what is most important is that they are warm and kind people.

Rubia is 56 years old, married and has three children who are all adults, married and independent.  Her husband is a driver.  They do not own their house; they are renters.

Rubia works making food to sell, a job she’s been doing for the last year.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed work schedule.

This is her third loan with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy dinnerware and foodstuffs to prepare her meals.  Her goal is to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy dinnerware and fodstuffs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos ya independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria (incompleta).
La señora se dedica a la venta  de abarrotes y zapatillas, hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará papa, chuño, golosinas chompas para niños y vender su mercadería en la ciudad de Arequipa.
Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en transportes (chofer).
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción para ella.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” communal bank located in Yunguyo District in Yunguyo Province, Puno Department.  She’s 52 years old, married and has two children who are independent now.  She did not complete elementary school.

She sells groceries and sandals.  She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years.  Her previous, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her business.  She will use this new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, snacks and children’s sweaters.  She will sell her merchandise in the city of Arequipa.  She works alone in her business; her husband works in transportation (driver).

Her dream is to stay in business and to improve her quality of life.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because they are a distraction for her.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, snacks and children's sweaters.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 37 años y 8 hijos.
Juana es feriante lleva a las ferias cereales, recuerda que con el primer crédito que obtuvo compró cereales para las ferias pero era en menor cantidad, ella se siente muy bien porque ha progresado, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a ser mejor persona y a tener muchos valores. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para poder compra cereales para las ferias pero ahora ella compra en mayor cantidad. Su meta es poder comprarse un carrito.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank.  She’s 37 years old and has 8 children.

Juana is a merchant in the markets.  She sells cereals.  She recalls that she used her first loan to buy cereals to sell in the markets but in a small quantity.  She feels very good because she’s made progress.  She loves the training because it helps her become a better person and to have many values.  The loan she’s asking for is to be able to buy cereals for the market but now she buys them in larger amounts.  Her goal is to be able to buy herself a little car.

loans.use: to buy cereals at wholesale.

loans.name: Luz Argentina

texts.es:
Luz Argentina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 55 años quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Este negocio lo inicio en su hogar pero desde hace 6 años lo traslado a un pequeño tramo al mercado. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos y en mejoras a la infra estructura del tramo ya que con las lluvias y un árbol que está ahí se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Luz Argentina is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She's 55 years old and works selling groceries.  She started this business in her home, and six years ago she moved it to a small plot in the market.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of products and in infrastructure improvements for her plot, which has deteriorated because of the rains and a tree that's there.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains and improve her plot.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió solo la primaria.
La señora se dedica a la venta de carne de ganado porcino,  vacuno, ovino y alpaca, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incremento al capital de su negocio.  Hace cinco años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos ovejas para luego carnearlas y vender la carne en el mercado, también la señora lleva carne en gran cantidad a la ciudad de Arequipa y Tacna, trabaja junto con su esposo.
La señora desea tener un puesto de venta en la ciudad de Arequipa y Tacna.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Silveria is a member of "La Yunguyeñita” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 46 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has two children.  She only studied up to elementary school level.

SIlveria sells pork, beef, mutton and alpaca meat.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used that money to increase her business capital.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.

Silveria will use this new loan for 500 soles to buy two sheep which she will later sell as meat in the market.  She also takes meat in large quantities to sell in the towns of Arequipa and Tacna.  She works together with her husband.

Silveria would like to have a sales stall in the towns of Arequipa and Tacna.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan and the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy two sheep which she will later sell as meat

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: La señora Aida Luz es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que desde hace ocho años ha hecho una vida vendiendo frutas y verduras. Ella usará el préstamo para comprar yuca, repollo, tomate, malanga, naranjas, etc. Ella tiene tres hijos, ya crecidos, y ella desea continuar trabajando y apostando a sí misma.
texts.en: Aida is a hardworking and enterprising woman who, for the past eight years, has been making a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to purchase manioc, cabbage, tomatoes, mangoes, oranges, etc. She has three grown-up children and wishes to keep on working and believing in herself.

loans.use: to purchase manioc, cabbage, tomatoes, mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es: Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito D. Mostaza, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 4 años. Eudomilia tiene un Bodega en su casa, es Profesora cesante, empezó su negocio hace mas D. 10 años, ella y su esposo se turnaban para poder atender en la tienda, empezaron con poco ahora su tienda ha crecido, gracias a Finca ella pudo administrar bien su negocio, el ahorro que le inculcan en su Banco Comunal le ayudó a poder hacer crecer su negocio mas rápido, ahora ella desea comprarse un carrito para poder pasar si vejez, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en vasos D. tecnopor para helados
texts.en:
Eudomilia is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito D. Mostaza” (Mustard Seed). She is 67 years old and has seven children. Eudomilia has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years. She is a retired school teacher and has a store in her home. Eudomilia started her business more than 10 years ago. She and her husband take turns managing the store. They started with very little, but now their business has grown. Thanks to FINCA Peru, Eudomilia has been able to manage her business well. The savings she accumulated through her Communal Bank has helped her to grow her business more quickly.

Now she wants to buy a small car so that she can travel around in her old age. At the moment, this loan will be invested in styrofoam cups for selling ice cream.

loans.use: to purchase styrofoam cups and other products for her business.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 46 años, se destaca por ser una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos de 28, 9 y 3 años. Juntos habitan casa de su madre en compañía de ella. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida y de pasamanería, ambos negocios lo realiza en el mercado “La hoyada”. Es así que su labor inicia desde muy temprano, que junto a su pareja se dirigen a su espacio donde expende la comida; por las mañanas, desayunos y por las tardes, almuerzos. Y en otro stand, vende productos de pasemanería. Tiene 10 años haciendo las misma actividad, y cada día mejora, por ello espera arreglar el piso de puesto de comida y dar mayor comodidad a sus consumidores. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, siempre le gustó desde muy niña, además gracias a ellos tiene buenos ingresos económicos. Este será el décimo crédito con MFP, y asegura que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos, materia prima para la preparación de alimentos, asimismo comprará pasamanería para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Inés, age 46, is a happy and very dynamic woman. She lives with her partner, with whom she has three children ages 28, 9 and 3. They live together in her mother's home with her mother. Ines sells food and braided items. She runs both businesses in the "La Hoyada" market. She starts work very early in the morning; she and her partner go to their canteen, where they sell breakfasts in the mornings and lunches in the afternoons. At the other stall, she sells braided products. She has been doing this for ten years, and every day is better. So, she hopes to fix up her canteen and provide her customers with greater comfort. She has always enjoyed cooking, even as a young child. Thanks to her cooking, she  makes a good income. This will be her tenth loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with the payments of her quotas. With the requested loan, she will purchase products, basic ingredients for making her food, and braided items to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients and corded products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 68  años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos ya independientes.  No cuenta con educación.
Junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. carne vacuno- porcino en el mercado, hace cinco años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su primer préstamo  fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. carne.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/.  3,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará quince corderos y chanchos, estos lo compra D. las ferias D. Pomata, Zepita, etc, para luego carnearlos y vender la carne en el mercado D. Yunguyo.
La señora desea continuar con el negocio y seguir sintiéndose útil.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” Communal Bank. She lives in the province and district of Yunguyo, in the Puno department. She is 68, married, and has 6 children who are already independent. She has no education. 
She and her husband sell beef and pork in the market.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years, and her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles; she invested this loan in her meat business.
With this new loan of 3,000 nuevo soles, she will purchase fifteen lambs and hogs from the Pomata, Zepita, and other markets. She will later slaughter them and sell the meat in the Yunguyo market.
She wants to continue with the business and to continue feeling useful. What she likes about her Communal Bank is the ease of getting a loan, the savings, and her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fifteen lambs and hogs.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene 45 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de panadería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio cuando un hermano le ayudo para que comprara un horno industrial fue con el paso del tiempo que Reyna aumento la producción y fue así que decide capacitar a personas para que trabajaran en su panadería. El crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, leche, piña, batidoras entre otros.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel is 45. She runs a bakery. She has had this business for three years. Her brother helped her to buy an industrial oven, and as time went on Reyna's production increased and she decided to train people to work in her bakery. This loan is for the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk, pineapple, beaters, and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk, pineapple, and beaters, among other items.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es  madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos.  Estudió la secundaria.
Desde hace un año trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de tres  ovinos para su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles comprará ocho animales, la señora cuenta que los animales los carnea y vende la carne en la ciudad de Arequipa y en el terminal pesquero, ella  viaja cada semana.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo.
La señora desea tener su casa propia y un carro para trasladar la mercadería.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la alegría de las socias  y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the "Central Vaquería" communal bank, located in the neighborhood of Vaquería, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 36 years old and a single mother of four children. She completed high school.
She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase three sheep for her business.
With her new loan of 2.000 nuevos soles she will purchase eight animals. She reports that she slaughters them and sells the meat in the town of Arequipa and at the fishing pier. She travels every week and she is helped in the business by her son.
She wishes to have her own house and a car to transport the goods.
What she likes about the communal bank is the joy of the members and also the savings.

loans.use: to purchase eight animals.

loans.name: Bertha Calderon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bertha Calderón lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Carla quien vende frijoles cocidos, leches, gaseosas y ropa desde hace 6 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de sandalias en Masaya, ya que desea empezar a vender este producto.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 17, 16 y 7 años de los cuales los dos mayores le ayudan en el negocio en sus tiempos libres.
Las otras integrantes son Mariela de los Ángeles de 27 años vende chiverías, repostería, gaseosa y fresco, y Martha Lorena de 32 años vende frijoles, leña y cosméticos desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The Bertha Calderón group consists of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women.  One of these is Carla who sells prepared beans, soft drinks and clothing for children up to 6 years of age.  She will use the loan to buy sandals in Masaya since she wants to start selling these items.
She has three children: 17, 16 and 7 and the two oldest help her with the business in their free time.

The other members are Mariela de los Ángeles , 27, who sells sweets, pastries, soft drinks and juices, and Martha Lorena, 32, who has sold beans, firewood, and cosmetics for the last 6 years.

loans.use: to buy sandals

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 1 hijo.  Estudió la primaria.
Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra de animales y venta  de carne.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro animales para su carneo,  la carne lo vende en la localidad de Ilave.  La señora trabaja sola en el negocio aunque a veces le ayuda su esposo, quien se dedica al servicio de mototaxi (transporte).
La señora desea seguir y  mejorar el negocio así aumentar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo, el ahorro y la alegría entre las socias.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Central Vaquería communal bank, located in the Vaquería area in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, and department of Puno.  She is 30 years old and married with one child.  She finished elementary school.

Her first loan was for the sum of 500 PEN, which she invested in her business of buying animals and selling meat.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for one year.

With this new loan of 500 PEN she will buy four animals for their meat.  She sells the meat in Ilave.  She works alone in the business, although sometimes her husband helps her.  He works in transportation, in mototaxi service.

Delia wants to continue and improve her business as well as increase her profits.

What she likes about the communal bank is the camaraderie, the savings, and the happiness among the members.

loans.use: to buy four animals for their meat.

loans.name: Lidia Catarina

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Catarina es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de telas típicas, cortes, perrajes, y entre otros tejidos, inició este trabajo como trabajadora y hasta ahora lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes clase y colores para poder producir mas tejidos, en el futuro espera ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia Catarina is married, 47, and has six years of elementary education. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She knits traditional fabrics; handwoven cloths, shawls, and other items. She started this work as a novice and now has three years' experience. Her husband, who also weaves, supports her.

She wants to request a loan for the purchase of different kinds and colours of threads for producing more knitted items. In the future she wants her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra  y venta de animales caseros, también tienen una panadería.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de tres ovinos.
Este nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevo soles, lo incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar una camionada de leña para su panadería. 
La señora desea seguir adelante con el negocio por ello es cumplida en sus pagos a Manuela Ramos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones,  la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Central Vaquería,” which is located in the Vaquería neighborhood of Llave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno.  She is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.  She completed secondary school.
Together with her husband, she makes her living buying and selling small livestock.  They also have a bakery.  Her first loan was for 500.00 PEN (about $180 USD) and she used the money to purchase three sheep.
This new loan for 700.00 PEN ($250 USD) will increase her business capital and allow her to purchase a truck load of firewood for her bakery.
The Señora hopes to continue moving forward with her business and be timely with her repayments to Manuela Ramos.	
What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the punctuality and responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to purchase a truckload of firewood.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 33 años, convive con Maritza de 22 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza en el distrito de Pichari. Él se destaca por ser un hombre muy entusiasta y emprendedor, ya que desde muy joven estuvo interesado por los trabajos del campo. El ver que sus vecinos obtenían buenas ganancias cultivando cacao y café, él también decidió emprender éste trabajo. Es así que aprovecho el terreno que su padre le cedió, y desde entonces cosecha café y cacao, y eso le ha ayudado a obtener ganancias y con ello derivarlo para los gastos del hogar. Él comenta, que en un inicio fue muy duro, pero gracias a la ayuda de su esposa y de algunos peones que contrato logró a tiempo terminar su faena en el campo. Ahora ha decidido ampliar la siembra de café y cacao. Se siente feliz con la labor que realiza, porque gracias a ello podrá al fin contruir su vivienda, asimismo dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, podrá comprar madera para empezar con la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Alfredos is 33 years old and lives with Maritza who is 22 years old and with whom he has 2 children.  Together they live in their own house, located in the community of Nueva Forteleza (New Strength) in the district of Pichari.  He is known for being a very enthusiastic and enterprising man, since from his youth he has been interested in working in the fields.  Seeing that his neighbors were earning good profits cultivating cacao and coffee, he also decided to undertake this work.  That is how he took advantage of the land that his father granted him, and since then he has harvested coffee and cacao and that has helped him to earn profits and use them for household expenses.  He comments that in the beginning it was very difficult, but thanks to the help of his wife and some laborers he contracted, he succeeded in finishing his tasks in the field on time.  Now, he has decided to expand the sowing of coffee and cacao.  He feels content with the work he does, because thanks to that, he will finally be able to to construct his home, as well as give a good education to his children.  This will be his first loan with MFP, for which he promises to be punctual with his payments.  With the 1,000 soles that he is requesting, he will be able to purchase wood in order to start with the construction of his house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the construction of his home.

loans.name: San Luis (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Luís está formado por 9 socias y 3 socios  quienes viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute, lugar de clima templado en donde se da una gran variedad de frutas, es un lugar propicio para la floricultura, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la venta de comida típica que encontramos a lo largo de toda su carretera, a la agricultura y cría de animales. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora Luz, vive por los alrededores del Cantón Paute, tiene 43 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los cuales cuatro son  independientes, tres trabajan y le ayudan en la económicamente y uno estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia pero vive en casa de su una de sus hijas.

Doña Luz se dedica a la venta de verduras y legumbres hace 20 años, vende sus productos solo los días de feria y tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la localidad. En su casa se dedica a la cría  pollos, cuyes y cerdos.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en sus dos negocios, va a comprar verduras para la venta, cuyes y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es tener un local para vender comida.
texts.en:
The San Luis communal bank has nine female and three male members who live on the outskirts of Paute Canton, an area of temperate climate with a wide variety of fruit, and a favorable place for floriculture.  The people work in commerce, selling typical food along the highway, and in agriculture and raising animals.  The people maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.  Our female members work in various activities that allow them to contribute to the economy of their homes and get their families ahead.

Luz is one of the members of this group.  She lives on the outskirts of Paute Canton and is 43 years old and divorced.  From her marriage she had eight children: four are independent, three work and help her economically, and one attends school locally.  She doesn't have her own home but she lives in the house of one of her daughters.

Luz has been selling vegetables and legumes for 20 years.  She sells her products only on market days, and she has her own stall in a market in the area.  At home she raises chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. 

This is her first loan from the communal bank and she's going to invest it in her two businesses.  She's going to buy vegetables to sell, guinea pigs, and food for her animals.

Her goal is to have a place to sell food.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, guinea pigs, and food for her animals.

loans.name: Amador

texts.es: Amador, de 37 años vive en concubinato hace 15 años con Rosina, su esposa. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los cuales quieren y protegen en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Caritá. Él es un hombre de iniciativa y proyectos. La siembra de papa, alverja, maíz, flor de gladiolo y habas, es su principal actividad económica. El cual lo realiza en terrenos que alquila anualmente, ya tiene 19 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo aprendió todas las técnicas de cultivo. Por ello obtiene buenas ganancias en cada cosecha que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Su principal dificultad es la falta de apoyo, pues tiene que contratar peones para que le ayuden a mantener y cuidar sus cultivos limpios y saludables. Ahora, cuenta que tiene sembrado papa, alverja y maíz, donde está seguro podrá tener buenas ganancias. Además dentro de unos meses; piensa invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de tubérculos, donde recibe cada año un dinero extra: “Ahí obtengo ganancias diarias”; concluye. Él pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo recibido en todo este tiempo. Espera continuar con su confianza; por ello promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Amador comenzará a sembrar alverja: por ello de recibir su apoyo comprará 2 bolsas de semilla y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próximo proyecto.
texts.en:
Amador, age 37, has been living with his wife Rosina for 15 years. They have three children, who they love and protect in their own home in the village of Caritá. Amador is a man of initiative who engages in projects. He grows potatoes, peas, corn, gladiolas, and beans as his main business activity. The crops are grown on land that he rents on an annual basis. Amador has 19 years of experience and has learned all types of farming techniques throughout this entire time. For this reason, he has obtained good earnings from each harvest. He sells his products at the wholesale market in the city. His main difficulty is the lack of manpower. For this reason, he has to hire workers to help with maintaining and caring for his crops by keeping them clean and healthy. Now he is planting potatoes, peas, and corn. He is confident that these crops will generate good earnings. In addition, within the next few months, Amador plans to invest in a business of buying and selling tubers so that he can earn some extra money every year. “This will help me generate some daily income,” concludes Amador.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Progreso Carita” and this will be his eighth loan with MFP. Amador appreciates the support he has received this entire time. He hopes to continue with the trust of the lenders, so he promises to be punctual with his payments. Amador will begin planting peas. For this reason, the money he received will be used to buy two bags of seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizers so that he can start his next project successfully.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años es una luchadora madre soltera. Vive junto a sus 2 hijas: Salome y Noe, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita.  Ella trabaja muy duro para salir adelante; se siente satisfecha por todo lo obtenido hasta hoy. Desde hace 21 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y alverja en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan paralelo a su casa, además cuenta con regadillo de agua a disposición. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las eternas horas que requiere para sacar el fruto maduro de la tierra; pues siente la alegría de poder vender sus cultivos después de tanto tiempo de trabajo. Según afirma en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma le compran a muy buen precio sus cosechas. Su mayor dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, razón por la cual comenzó a realizar queso con la leche que produce las vacas que posee. Según cuenta cada día vende 5 moldes. Ahora está planeando viajar a la capital de país a comercializar sus sembríos, pues ahí son más cotizados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el apoyo que obtiene; le ayuda a seguir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. María está pensando sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay” y “andina”; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito la temporada agrícola.
texts.en:
María, age 41, is a determined single mother. She lives with her two daughters, Salome and Noe, in her own home in the village of Carita. María works very hard to get ahead and is satisfied with what she has obtained up to this point. For the past 21 years, she has been growing potatoes, beans, and peas on two hectares of farmland that is situated parallel to her house. She also has an irrigation system at her disposal. What she enjoys most about her work are the endless hours required to achieve ripe fruit from the land. María feels happy when she can sell her crops after investing so much time into her work. She says that the wholesale market in the city of Tarma buys her crops for a very good price. Her greatest difficulty is paying the expenses related to her children’s university studies. For this reason, she began making cheese using the milk produced by her cows. María says that she sells five cheese molds every day. Now she is planning to travel to Lima in order to sell her crops because there is more demand.

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Progreso Carita” and this will be her tenth loan with MFP. She feels fulfilled because of the support she has received so that she can continue pressing forward. In addition, she promises to be prompt with her payments. María is planning to plant potatoes of the “Yungay” and “Andina” varieties. For this reason, she will invest the money she requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers so that she can begin a successful farming season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 59 años; es una mujer luchadora. Hace 2 años enviudó y desde entonces se hace cargo de sus 2 menores hijos. Con los cuales vive en el caserío de Carita. Cuenta nostálgica que desde hace 36 años, comenzó en la agricultura, donde sembraba en compañía de su esposo. A pesar de estar sola, sigue trabajando con mucho ahínco; pues tiene que velar por sus hijos. Su principal sembríos constan de papa, alverja y maíz; los cuales siembra en sus terrenos propios. En todo este tiempo pudo obtener buenos compradores, pues vende la semilla de papa que produce; a los grandes comerciantes mayoristas. Además de tener 3 vacas lecheras, donde hace queso; según cuenta un promedio de 5 moldes diarios, los que vende en la feria dominical. Ahora ella se está preparando para la próxima cosecha donde espera obtener buenas ganancias. Pues sus planes son mejorar sus cultivos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, ya que es el único sustento de su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibió en todo estos años. Espera nuevamente su apoyo; por ello promete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Elsa piensa sembrar papa de la variedad “única” y “pericholi”; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de guano de corral (fertilizante natural), para comenzar con éxito su siembra; y si el dinero le alcanza pagará el arriendo de sus terrenos productivos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old and a determined woman. Two years ago, she became a widow and was left in charge of her two dependent children who live with her in the village of Carita. She remembers nostalgically when she started farming 36 years ago alongside her husband. Despite being alone, Elsa continues to work with great diligence so that she can take care of her children. Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas, and corn that she grows on her own land. Every time she is able to obtain good buyers who then sell the seed potatoes that she produces to the wholesale merchants. In addition, Elsa has three dairy cows that produce milk for making cheese. She says that she produces an average of five cheese molds per day and then sells them at the Sunday fair. Now she is preparing for the next harvest and hopes to obtain good earnings. Her plans are to improve her crops so that she can pay for her children’s education since this is the only source of income for her family.

Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Progreso Carita” and will be receiving her eighth loan from MFP. She is grateful for the support she has received all these years and promises to be punctual with her payments. Elsa plans to plant potatoes of the “Única” and “Pericholi” varieties. For this reason, the money she requested will be invested in the purchase of guano manure (a type of natural fertilizer) so that she can begin a successful planting. If there is any money left over, she will pay the rent on her productive farmland.

loans.use: to purchase guano manure (to use as fertilizer) and to pay the rent on her farmland.

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas está formado por 10 socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy amables quienes con su trabajo diario aportan a  la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y esta rodeado de montañas, es una de las zonas más fértiles para la agricultura, su gente es amabley mantienen las tradiciones de sus ancestros.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora Luzmila, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle, tiene 53 años, es separada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 5 hijos, tres de ellos son casados e independientes, sus hijos solteros tienen 20 y 14 años de edad, su hijo de 20 años trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su ultima hija estudia en una academia de corte y confección. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Luzmila como pasa en el campo se dedica a la cría y venta cuyes, pollos y cerdos y solo cuando le llaman trabaja labrando la tierra.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. 

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría y venta de animales.

Las fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de dos socias que por motivos personales no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Minas” (The Mines) consists of 10 members who are hardworking, determined, and friendly women who work every day to support the finances of their households. They live in the parish of El Valle, a cold place that is surrounded by mountains. It has one of the most fertile areas for farming. The people are friendly and have maintained the traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Luzmila. She lives in the outlying areas surrounding the parish of El Valle. Luzmila is 53 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five children. Three of them are married and independent while the others (ages 20 and 14) are single. Her 20-year-old son works and helps financially while her youngest daughter is a student at a sewing and dressmaking academy. Luzmila does not own a home, so she lives in a rental property.

Doña Luzmila spends her time in the field raising and selling guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She works alone on her land whenever she feels the need.

Luzmila is seeking her second loan with the Communal Bank and will invest the money in the purchase of chickens and the appropriate feed. Her goal is to grow her business of raising and selling animals.

The smaller photos are of two of the members who could not be present at the time the group photo was taken because of personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and materials for waterproofing her house.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse algo pero sin descuidar su hogar hace 10 años se dedica a la cría de chanchos y vacas, ella tienen 8 vacas lecheras las mismas que las ordeñan dos veces al dia para luego vender la leche y derivados de esta como queso y mantequilla, nos cuenta que una vez que ella fabrica estos productos los lleva a entregar a clientes que tiene en la ciudad o a tiendas del cantón. Tiene una persona para el trabajo de ordeño y alimentación de las vacas a la cual le paga un sueldo mensual. 

Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para los chanchos y vacas. Lleva 9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y ver que sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Luz” (New Light) meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful scenery and the lovely freshwater spas that are frequented by many tourists.

Sra. Ana lives in this place. She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 11 and 7) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Ana is a homemaker who has been raising pigs and cows for 10 years so that she can earn some income without neglecting her household. She has eight dairy cows that are milked twice a day. Ana sells the milk and its by-products, such as cheese and butter. She says that as soon as she makes her products, she delivers them to her customers in the city or to stores in the canton. Ana has an employee who is paid a monthly salary for milking and feeding the cows.

This loan will be used to buy feed and medicines for her pigs and cows. Ana has been with the Communal Bank for nine years and enjoys the assistance she has received. Her goals are to move forward in her business and to see that her children lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs and cows.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: La señora Juanita es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta el oficio de comercio por lo que desde hace 4 años inicio su negocio de venta de ropa usada en una de las colonias muy pobladas de la ciudad. La señora es madre de 2 pequeños y esta en espera de uno nuevo a los cuales quiere ofrecer una calidad de vida y un mejor patrimonio. Para Juanita es muy difícil ser madre y padre a la vez, ya que su esposo por cuestiones de trabajo no puede estar al tanto de sus hijos, pero si responde en el ámbito económico. Es una de las cosas por las que opto por tener su propio negocio, ya que es la forma que podrá atender a sus pequeños sin ningún problema. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar ropa de temporada
texts.en:
Sra. Juanita is a hardworking woman who enjoys the retail trade. Four years ago, she started her business of selling used clothes in one of the most populated neighborhoods in the city. Juanita is the mother of two small children and is expecting another one, which is why she wants to offer her family a better quality of life and a better inheritance. For Juanita, it is difficult to be both mother and father at the same time since her husband cannot be with the children because of work. However, he does provide financial support. This is one of the things she had to consider when starting her own business, so working in this manner allows her to look after her young children without any problems.

In order for her business to continue generating income, she needs to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn  is married with three children. Marlyn is 30 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.

Marlyn sells foods to earn a living and has had this business for two months.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending.

Marlyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months.  In the future, Marlyn hopes to sustain her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her food vending.

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is married with five children. Cherlie is 37 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte.

Cherlie sells seafood like crabs and fish to earn a living and has had this business for nine years. All their basics needs are supplied by the profit she earn by selling crabs to her community.

She earns PHP 8000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more crabs and fish to sell.

Cherlie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Cherlie hopes that in the future her business will improve and expand to sustain their daily life, as well as the education of her children.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and fish to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. Theresa is able to help provide for her family's needs through her income from farming.

Theresa has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Luz has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Luz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Christine has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Christine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Christine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Aida has a food cart selling home-made ice cream in different  flavors. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

loans.name: Rhonda

texts.en:
Rhonda is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Rhonda has a retail shop that sells spices, vegetables & food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables to sell.

Rhonda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhonda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Visitacion has a food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like "afritada" & "caldereta". She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands for sale.

Visitacion is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Visitacion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands for sale.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married with four children.  Leonida is 41 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor.

Leonida has a small grocery store as one of their major sources of income and has had this business for two years.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Leonida has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Leonida hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Profiteza

texts.en:
Profiteza is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Profiteza has a videoke or karaoke shop that provides karaoke services costing five pesos per song. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for utilities like electricity for maintenance of her business.

Profiteza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Profiteza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for utilities like electricity.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married and blessed with one child. Violeta is 54 years of age and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Violeta has a small farm. She plants various fruits and vegetables like "santol", squash, string beans, "kangkong" and others. To earn a living Violeta sells vegetables to a buyer in the market. She has been engaged in this business for five years. Violeta has a net income every month in the amount of PHP 2500 with this line of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

Violeta has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years.  Violeta wishes to buy another piece of land where she can plant more vegetables and fruits.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Malvar

texts.en:
Malvar is an honest and a responsible man. He spends most of his time providing good customer service in his general store. He sells canned goods, breads, soap, shampoo and toothpaste to the people in his village. He also sells medicines. He had been operating his general store for almost 10 years.

Malvar is 45 years old and has two grown-up children.

Malvar is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar and medicines to sell in his store. He needs additional items to sell in order to boost his profits. 

He wants to keep making better sales and continue growing as an entrepreneur. In the future, he would like to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar and medicines to sell in his store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with six children. 

Sonia has a retail shop that sells generic medicines like Paracetamol & Ambroxol. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy generic medicines for sale.

Sonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy generic medicines for sale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Marilyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marilyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is married with three children.  Virgincita is 55 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Virgincita sells "longganisa" every day and has has this type of business for three months.  She has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for the "longganisa" business to sell in her neighborhood.

Virgincita has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, Virgincita hopes to gain more income and have savings deposited for her family`s good future.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for 'longganisa' (sausages) to sell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of 12 children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from raising chickens.  Susan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
Dionita is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is engaged in rice farming and hog-raising businesses. Dionita's husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. She helps plant rice crops and keep the farm free of weeds and pests. She also raises pigs in their backyard.

Dionita requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina, a 36-year-old married mother of seven children, lives in the Philippines where she has had a junk shop for the past seven years that buys and sells recycled bottles and metals. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of recycled metals and bottles to sell.

In the future, Delfina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of recycled metals & bottles to sell.

loans.name: Dominga Elena

texts.en:
Dominga Elenais, a 43-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a junk shop that buys and sells recycled bottles and metals for the past seven years. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled bottles and metals to sell.

In the future, Dominga Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled bottles & metals to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a 67-year-old married woman with 8 children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Fe helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. She also raises pigs to fatten and sell. Fe works hard to help improve her family's living situation. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials. Fe hopes this loan will help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle  is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and pregnant. 

Michelle  has a junk shop that sells recycled bottles & metals. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled bottles & metals for resale.

Michelle  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Michelle  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled bottles & metals for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 47-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 23 and 20. Her husband works as a farmer.

Judith is also a farmer. She helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. Judith's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Judith, on the other hand, focuses more on her eatery and a small videoke shop. Judith cooks the food that she sells at her eatery.

Judith would like to request a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and raw ingredients for her eatery such as meat and vegetables. Judith hopes to prosper in all her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and raw ingredients for her eatery such as meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Mercy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mercy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mercy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en:
Marie Fe is a single-mother of one child.  Maria Fe is 22 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.

She sells snacks and viands to earn a living and has had this type of business for two years.  She has a requested loan of PHP 7000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Marie Fe has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, Marie Fe hopes to improve her living condition and be able to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, aged 24 and 22. Gelinda's husband works as a farmer.

Gelinda is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice on their land. Gelinda also runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells items like bread and canned goods. Gelinda plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies, and also more items to sell at the store.

In the future, Gelinda hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies, and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Ailyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in the store .
Ailyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Pearly has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store.
Pearly is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Pearly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children between 12 and 25 years old. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice and vegetables to sell. Elizabeth also raises pigs to help augment their income.

Elizabeth requested this loan to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Lenie has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Lenie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Evelynda

texts.en:
Evelynda is 47 years old. She is married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelynda provides motorcycle transport services to the local community. Evelynda has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly.

Evelynda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new tires for her motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
This is Rosally, 25, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a seaman, and is mother to her only child. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses

Rosally is a soft drink distributor. She buys soft drinks from a company or supplier, and then sells them by the case to earn a profit. Her regular customers are variety stores in her community. She does a minimum of 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of soft drinks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosally hopes to expand her business and acquire a house someday. She also wants to give her child a high quality education by working hard in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. In these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Elizabeth has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Elizabeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old farmer who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She hires farmers from her town to help till her land. Rice is her main crop. 

She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Maria has requested a loan to purchase feed, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Maria hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase feed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 
Letecia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Letecia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Tessie has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Tessie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina farms rice and corn in the Philippines. She is 41 years old and married. Dina has three children who are all in school. Her husband is also a farmer and her partner in managing the farm. 

Dina has been in farming for 21 years. With her experience in rice farming, she is confident that her rice is high quality and always sees to it that her crops are in good condition. Her profit in rice farming depends on the weather and amount of fertilizer applied to the crops.

Dina wants to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her rice farm. The loan will be a big help in earning a higher income because she will be able to buy the farm supplies she needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Jenelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Jenelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Corazon is very happy selling fish. She walks around their community and shouts fish: "isda." Her fish are inside her pail. Selling fish is her major source of income for the family. She earns PHP 2,400. She has been in this business for five years. Corazon has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Corazon has been a member of GDMPC for about one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish business to pay for their daily expenses and hopes to have own stall in the market (so that she does need to walk around selling fish).

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married. She has five children and lives with them and her husband in Isabela. Lolita and her husband earn money by running a grocery store from the door of their house. They started this business nine years ago.

Lolita requires a loan to expand her business by purchasing many kinds of products, such as toothpaste, shampoo and personal sanitary items, to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enable her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, spices and bread for her store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Joy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Joy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en: Meralyn is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is only three. Meralyn and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice to sell to their community. Meralyn's husband mainly manages their farm, while Meralyn focuses on selling fresh fish at her town's market. Meralyn does her best to augment their income and sustain their family. She plans to use her loan to purchase farm inputs and more fish to sell. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and more fish to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Rose has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverage.

Rose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Metchico

texts.en:
Metchico is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 26 years old. Metchico's husband is a farmer.

Metchico is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Metchico focuses more on hog-raising now. She has a small backyard piggery where she fattens pigs to sell at the market. Metchico does her best to support her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies. She hopes for their farm and piggery to grow.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a single mother with one child. She is 25 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

 May has a small stall in her home and sells fruit like bananas to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She earns PHP 1,500 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional bananas to sell and a portion of her loan will purchase goods to sell like shampoo, sugar, eggs and other basic needs to earn more income.

May has been a member of GDMPC for about one year. In the future, May hopes to expand her business of fruit vending and build a sari-sari store or general store not only in her place but in other places.


About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, shampoo, sugar, eggs and other basic needs to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 57, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with one child who is now studying in college.  She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leticia operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Aside from this, she sells a variety of basic products in her store. Leticia’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 48,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leticia hopes her business will grow and she dreams of being able to give her child a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work 1n her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for bread production

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa was born in Ilagan Province of Isabela. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children.

At present, Luisa lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities. She buys pigs and resells them later. Luisa needs a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise.

Luisa is a very hardworking mother. In the future, she plans to establish a new business for additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her business

loans.name: Procelda

texts.en:
Procelda is 39 years old and married. She has 3 children ageds11, 8 and 3. Procelda is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Procelda also raises pigs in her backyard.

Procelda has requested a loan to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en:
The Berawan Salak Permai group received another loan from MUK for Rp 15,000,000. Each of the 10 members gets Rp 1,500,000. These loans are used to support their efforts at raising pigs.

Ni Kadek used this loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is Rp 450,000 per piglet. The remainder of the loan was used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Kadek is feeding with traditional foods made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves. Ni Kadek pursues this effort to support the family economy, particularly the cost of education for her two children.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets

loans.name: Mariam Group

texts.en:
Mariam is married with two children. Mariam is 26 years old and lives in Del Pilar, Baliangao.
Mariam sells electronic load (prepaid cell phone credits) to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns PHP 2500 doing this type of work. Mariam has requested a loan for PHP 3000 to purchase electronic load for her electronic loading business.
Mariam is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase electronic load for her Electronic Loading Business

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is happily married and blessed  with three school-age children. Elita is 50 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Elita sells fruit like bananas and she sells also straw, "hinis"-used to clean pots and "chicharon"-skin of pig and cow to earn a living. Elita had been in this business for 6 years.

Elita earns a net income of PHP 5000 every month. She has requested a loan for PHP 15000 use to purchase additional bananas so sell in the market.

Elita has been a member of GDMPC for about 1 year.  In the future, Elita hopes to expand her business to the neighboring places.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: People empowering people.

loans.use: additional capital in purchasing fruits

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 52 years old and married with eight school-age children. Carmelita raises pigs to fatten and sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her  business

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her livestock business. With the loan, she will buy goats and sheep. She will raise them up by giving them good food and then sell on EID (Muslims occasion) and to butchers for profits. 

Naseem is the mother of 7 children. Her daughters are staff nurses while her sons are getting their education. Her husband is 71 years old and can’t do work at such an older age so he stays at home. 
Naseem also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife as well.  

Naseem is hopeful that through the loan investment she will be able to improve the financial condition of her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for her livestock business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida believes that, "Patience and hard work" are the only weapon to fight poverty. She is a mother who is now 61 years old and has four adult children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village while her husband manages their farm land. She has been in this business for almost 10 years earning profits of P9,000 a month which she usually spends on the education of her children and to cover their basic necessities. 

They endure hardships and difficulties for they want their children to finish their studies and earn their degree. As a fruit of their patience and hard work, most of their children become professionals and have a good job. They mentioned that this is their big accomplishment in life. 
 
At present, Brigida aims to continue and improve the business to have a stable source of income. She is asking for additional capital of P32,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, candies, beverages, soaps and shampoos to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business as she continue to work hard.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, candies, beverages, soaps and shampoos to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is from the village of Ilagan, province of Isabela. She’s 45 years old, married and has five children. Pacita is a very loving and patient mother to her family.
