Pacita lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her various economic activities. She is a housewife and after doing her household chores Pacita is involved in buying and selling vegetables in her community. She needs the loan of 7,000 PHP to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, tomato and eggplant for her business.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group.  She is 30 and, together with her husband who is a farmer, she raises two sons both of whom study at school. Six years ago with an initial investment of 4000 soms the family started to breed cattle and then resell it at the higher price after being fattened. In this way the family earns about 6000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the trade Nazira meets the family needs. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future Nazira wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married with 2 children. Joel is 40 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Joel operates his own motorcycle to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Monthly he earns PHP  2000 doing this type of business. To improve his service in transportation he has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.
 
Joel has been a member of GDMPC for about 1 year.  In the future, Joel hopes to have another motorcycle for more earnings for his family's needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy  spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло житель района Кумсангир. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Кудратулло более пяти лет занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом бахчевых культур. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и приобретения участка земли. Кудратулло хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Kudratullo lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 30 years old, married and has two children.  His wife takes care of the household.  Kudratullo has been involved in growing vegetables and sowing melon cultures for over five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and a plot of land.  Kudratullo wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and a plot of land

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is an active lady and performs her household responsibilities by staying at home. Besides her household work she also crafts embroidery on clothes for her neighboring clients. 
 
Her husband operates a small medical store where he sells regular medicines to his customers. He is very fair in his rates and makes good sales and profits every month. 
 
Sakina is the mother of 8 children: her eldest son is an electrician while others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase medicines in bulk to be able to fulfill the customer demands and increase his sales and profits.  

He is well experienced in his business and Sakina hopes that an investment will be profitable one for his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines for selling.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургуль 28 лет, замужем и имеет двух детей 5 и 8 лет.  В 2006 Нургуль начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктовыми товарами, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день магазин Нургуль приносит ежемесячную прибыль  в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Нургуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры»  за кредитом в сумме 72,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота.  Доходы от кредита Нургуль планирует направить на покупку бытовой техники для своей семьи.
texts.en: Nurgul is 28 years old, married and has two children aged 5 and 8. In 2006 Nurgul started her grocery store, using 60,000 som (KGS) as starting capital. Currently, Nurgul's store makes a profit of 5000 som (KGS) every month. In order to expand her business, Nurgul has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 72,000 som (KGS) to expand her store's inventory. Nurgul is planning to use increased profits from the store to purchase new appliances for her family.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is 29 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Geralyn has had a food shop where she makes and sells chicken and pork barbecue. She is a new HSPFI member. 

Geralyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy the raw ingredients she needs for making barbecue. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making barbecue

loans.name: Victorio

texts.en:
Victorio is 51 years old and single. He lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. For the past 23 years, he has owned and operated a piggery in his barangay (village) and he earns 5,000 PHP each month. Victorio has been a member of GDMPC for about a year.  

Victorio is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy feed and supplies for his pigs. His loan will  help him to buy what he needs. Victorio's major business problem is the diseases he encounters. In the future, his dream is to buy more pigs and increase production. 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC is people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 30 years old is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Rosela has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is a new HSPFI member.

Rosela is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Trọng's Group

texts.en:
Trọng  is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong distict - Bắc Ninh province. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên trà 04 (8).

Trọng is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Trọng owns and operates a waste-management business. Her main source of income comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Trọng has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

Trọng joined SEDA in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase scrap metal to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her third loan from SEDA. Trọng plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her business.

About the other borrowers: 

Kim is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her agricultural business raising pigs and chicken.

Sự is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her agricultural business raising pigs.

Quy is a 30-year-old male who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support his manufacturing business making furniture.

Chúc is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business making furniture. 

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Seiylkan's Group

texts.en:
Seiylkan is the leader of this group. She is 67 and married to a farmer. Seiylkan has raised a son who is now 24 and is also a farmer. In order to earn money and provide for their livelihood, Seiylkan and her family cultivate agricultural products and breed livestock. They sell part of their harvest and their fattened livestock and earn about 5,000 KGS per month. 

Seiylkan is requesting a loan to expand their livestock business and purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she hopes to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 49 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Nelia has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is a new HSPFI member.

Nelia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en:
Lorenda is 53 years old and married with seven children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 10 years, Lorenda has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is a new HSPFI member.

Lorenda is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 36 years old and is married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past four years, Rosalia has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and rice by the kilogram. She is a new HSPFI member.

Rosalia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy snacks and sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and rice to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 23 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a retail shop where she sells gasoline by the liter. She is a new HSPFI member. 

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to gallons of gasoline to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 26 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, she has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Alma is a new HSPFI member.

Alma is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Kenjekan's Group

texts.en:
Kenjekan is the leader of this group. She is 45, and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up three sons and a daughter; the sons are at school and the daughter is not yet, as she is pre-school age (under seven). 

Three years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms Kenjekan started to sell grocery goods. In this way she earns money to meet the family needs, and her monthly profit is about 6000 soms. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase more products for trade: sugar, beverages, cookies and oil. 

In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house for her children.



--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sugar, beverages, cookies and oil to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is aged 37 and a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with three children aged between 7 and 3 years, and has been in farming for 6 years. He currently employs one farmhand and produces milk which he sells to the local market.

Erick has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He had previously acquired a loan of 45,000 KES which he repaid promptly. He does not have any other source of income and says the loan will help improve his family's living standards and educate his children. He also wants to rear only pure breeds in future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sunshine

texts.en:
Sunshine is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Sunshine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Sunshine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sunshine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Kerenlee

texts.en:
Kerenlee started her farming business four years ago together with her husband, who sows and transplants the rice seedlings in her one-hectare rice field. She usually earns a yield twice a month and uses it to sustain their basic needs. 

She needs to improve her crop production for a higher income but she has insufficient capital to pay for land cultivation and buy seeds and fertilizers for her rice field. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. 

In the future, Kerenlee wants to strengthen her farming business and produce an abundant harvest to save for the college education of her child.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation, seeds and fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Angela has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Angela is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Angela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Emmie Rose

texts.en: Emmie Rose is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Emmie Rose has a grocery store and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory. Emmie Rose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emmie Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine sells different kinds of products in her mini store or general store to earn a living. She is married with four children. Josephine is 54 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has unluckily encountered problems because of the crisis. But, in spite of that, she is a determined person. She believes that nothing is impossible. She is striving hard to cope with things. 

Josephine is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more goods to sell and to be more progressive. She plans to build a new house. 

======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store (sari-sari store)

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Shirly has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads, dried fish and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Shirly is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 41 years of age. She is a very supportive person in nature, supporting her husband in operating his livestock business. She gets up early in the morning and gets milk from the buffalo and cows so her husband can sell them to his clients and earn income for the family.

She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.  She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son is studying in a nearby school while her daughter stays with her.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. Her husband has a good number of clients in his community who purchase milk from him regularly. He is very experienced in his business and Naseem hopes that an investment will make his business more profitable.

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Connie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned good, snacks and beverages.

Connie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Connie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned good, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Кумсангир. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети маленькие. Сам он более пяти лет занимается растениеводством. У него имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 29 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker, and children are little.  Bakhtiyor has been involved in agriculture for over five years.  He has a small plot of land, where he grows vegetables and cereal crops.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Eden has a retail shop that sells vegetables and spices. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables and spices to sell.

Eden is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eden hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
The primary source of income for the village comes from rice and corn farming, and Mildred's family is involved in this business. She plants and harvests rice and later sells it to traders in the village. She usually earns a net income of 30,000 PHP. She uses that for daily meals, tuition fees and allowances for her three children, all of whom she is sending to college.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds and herbicides used in farming. Through the help of this loan, she will improve her crop production and earn higher profits. 

Mildred would be happy and satisfied, despite poverty, if all her children would earn a degree and have good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Guljamal's Group

texts.en:
Guljamal is the leader of this group. She is 21 and, together with her husband, she brings up a son and a daughter. Both children are of preschool age. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 15000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. With the profits gained from reselling livestock they earn money to meet the family's needs. The monthly profit from the business is 3000 soms. With the loan, Guljamal wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wants to purchase a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Vivian has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato cues. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making banana cues.
Vivian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making banana cues

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Josefa has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato cue & fried chicken intestine. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making banana cue.
Josefa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josefa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making banana cue

loans.name: Ladylyn

texts.en:
Ladylyn is 24 years old and lives with her husband and her one child. She lives in San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga sel Norte, Philippines.

Ladylyn works in agriculture growing vegetables like okra and eggplant. She buys and sells her products in in Rizal Public Market. She earns Php 3000 a month and has been engaged in this line of business for a year.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizer for her crops. The loan will help her to buy what she needs. She encounters problems such as pests. Her dream is to buy more land to increase production.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives and works as a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is aged 26, single and has been farming for the past 3 years. He produces and sells eggs, vegetables and beans to the local market.

Leonard has made a request for 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan request of a similar amount. He says the acquisition of a new dairy cow will provide milk for the family's consumption and generate additional income from sales. He is focusing on owning five dairy cows and buying a motorcycle to make deliveries to the market.

Leonard says their main challenge is animal disease.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anne Lyn

texts.en:
Anne Lyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Anne Lyn has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON.
Anne Lyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anne Lyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Being a father is to be responsible for supporting and providing for all family needs and giving one's family a better life. Likewise, Amor who is a father of three, aims to improve their standard of living and to give his family a better life. He has been a farmer for almost 38 years planting and harvesting rice for sale. Due to financial difficulty, he has engaged in raising fingerlings (fish hatchlings) to generate additional income. 

He aimed to strengthen this business to have a stable source of income. He is asking for an additional capital of P40,000 to buy feed and additional fingerlings to raise. He believes that through this loan, he will able to improve the business as he continues to work hard and manage his business well. He hopes that in the future, he will make the business grow and their life will also improve.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional fingerlings (fish hatchlings) to raise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 
Nancy has a retail shop that sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Nancy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables, food seasoning & spices to sell

loans.name: Begimkul

texts.ru: Бегимкул проживает в районе Кумсангир. Холост. Ему 22 года. Он живет вместе с родителями. У него среднее образование. Бегумкул шесть лет как занимается выращиванием овощей и бахчевых культур. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Begimkul lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 22 years and single.  He lives together with his parents.  He has a secondary education.  Begimkul has been involved in growing vegetables and melon cultures for over six years.  He primarily grows vegetables for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds to sow and get a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing

loans.name: Omurgul's Group

texts.en:
Omurgul is the treasurer of this group. She is 29 and, together with her husband, she brings up four sons. The two older sons study at school and the other sons are of preschool age. Her husband earns money by transporting passengers and Omurgul sells dairy products. She started this business nine years ago with an initial investment of 17000 soms. Currently her monthly profit is 12000 soms. With the profits, Omurgul has built a sauna and a kiosk. With the loan she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is a local farmer who lives in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan with his wife and one child. He had been cultivating rice for almost two years. He usually sell it to traders and earns about P20,000 each harvest season. Praxedes was not an expert in this kind of work but, with his determination to improve his crop production, he strives hard to maintain good crops. 

Due to insufficient funds, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy crude oil for the machines used in land cultivation and, also, seeds to transplant.

Every crop season, Praxedes would like to achieve an abundant harvest to earn money for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy crude oil for his farming machines and seeds to transplant

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is a very supportive person by nature. She runs a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. 
Her husband works in a livestock business. He has some buffaloes. He gets milk from them which he sells to his community clients and, thus, generates income for the family. 
Her husband started this business some time ago and it is working well for him. He has a good number of clients who purchase milk from him regularly. 
Ameeran is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. She has given birth to 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her sons are studying while her daughters remain at home and do household work with Ameeran. 
Ameeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.
She is confident that her husband’s business will improve as a result of the loan investment and that her household income will increase.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married and blessed with 8 children with her husband. She is 48 years old and lives in Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental.

Magdalina sells snacks like banana cue and barbecue(chicken feet) to earn an income. She enjoys this kind of business, meeting different kinds of people. Problems come along but she has been able to solve them. She is able to earn a net income PHP 3000 a month. She has been in this business for a year.

Magdalina is asking for a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase additional banana for banana cue and also to purchase chicken legs for barbecue. Magdalina has been a member of GDMPC for about a year. She is looking forward to being able to renovate her house and send her children to college in the future.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and materials to make snacks

loans.name: Robie Jane

texts.en:
Robie Jane is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. 
Robie Jane has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of used clothing.
Robie Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Asuncion has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 51 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Asuncion has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Asuncion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is 48 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife works as a librarian at the local high school. He started driving a taxi one year ago after purchasing a car. He is planning to replace his current car with a newer one. He is a diligent man who says, "I want to change my car and buy a good one this time. This will help my business very much." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Isolde

texts.en:
Isolde is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Isolde has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Isolde is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tukei

texts.en:
Tukei is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a farmer and has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in the area where he lives. He has been a good client and this will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build a rental premise. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Vina has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like caldereta (beef stew), afritada (chicken dish) & bihon (classic Filipino noodle dish). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands for sale.
Vina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Vina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands (food items) for sale

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, 33, is married and has two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He applied for his first loan with KADET which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and also land preparation). With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of being a well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Angeline has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Angeline is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 37 years old, married and her husband works in a brick furnace, making bricks. His duty hours are very long but his income is very low. Their poor financial situation is why Sajida couldn’t provide an education for her son. 
She is a housewife and fulfils her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her duties very well. 
Her only son operates a grocery store where he sells daily-use items such as spices, sugar, rice, cooking oil and lentils at reasonable rates. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store. That will allow him to meet customer demand and make more profit. 
Sajida is hopeful that an investment will help him in establishing his business and increasing his profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of meat for sale

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 
Nick has a shop that sells firewood & coconut charcoal. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy firewood to sell.
Nick is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nick hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and additional fingerlings (fish hatchlings) to raise

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Violeta has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Violeta is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jerlito

texts.en:
Jerlito is a 42-year-old farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is still single and hopes to have his own family someday. 

Jerlito primarily grows rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, he also has a tricycle transport business. Jerlito works hard to save for his future and to support his family financially. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and tricycle spare parts and gasoline. He hopes to improve his living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and tricycle spare parts and gasoline.

loans.name: Lindaflor

texts.en:
Lindaflor is 47 years old. She is engaged in selling vegetables. She has a small plot of land where she plants vegetables, such as eggplants, and sells them at harvesting season. 

Lindaflor earns money to cover the expenses for the education of her three children. She is thankful that they are helping her in cultivating and planting. But the problem is that she doesn’t have enough working capital to buy the necessities for planting. For this reason, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP5,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. to buy seeds (beans, eggplant and squash), plastic mulching and organic fertilizer. This will be a big help in expanding and upgrading her business. She hopes to improve her business in order to earn a higher income and save for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds (beans, eggplant and squash), plastic mulching and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marlyn has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 36 years old. He is married and supports four people in his family. He is a farmer and he has been doing this work for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Jeremiah learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan. He is planning to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. He has repaid his previous loan successfully. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a hard working man who can do more, if supported financially

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is 30 years old and a wife of a carpenter. They were blessed with four children, two of which are in school. With the help of a hog-fattening business, she is earning an income though she stays at home. This occupation provides allowances of her children as well as their daily expenses. 

With the aspiration to increase profit each time, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy two more hogs and feed. This will make her work harder in order to make her hogs healthier and fatter. She hopes that with the help from Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc, she could improve her profit and upgrade their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en:
Rainer is married with 2 children. He is 37 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Rainer owns and manages sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month he earns  PHP 5000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan PHP 15000.  Rainer has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rainer hope to expand his sari-sari store to sustain his family's daily needs and for the education of his children.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell, and a portion will be used for house repair

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old. He is married and the father of fifteen children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to prepare his maize farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his wheat production, and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is a hard working man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To prepare his maize farm

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Ester has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Ester is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ester hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is a dynamic mother of four children. With her determination to send all her children to school, she is operating a piggery business as a source of income. This business is quite smelly and risky, yet it provides a better living for their family. Though she experiences difficulty and tiredness in caring for her pigs, she still does everything to provide for their needs.

For this reason, the 29-year-old mother is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feeds and pigs. With the difficulties and suffering in her occupation, she knows that she will earn a convenient life as a replacement soon. She said that through patience and perseverance, each destitute life will be prospered.

She knows that her loan from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran, Inc., would cause their life to be better and allow her to send her children to school until they finish.

loans.use: to buy feeds and pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 63-year-old married woman with two adult children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Francisca grows rice crops on her land. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Francisca works hard to support her family.

Francisca requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds. Francisca hopes to expand her businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 42 years old. She has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for five months. Within these months of her existing business, she has usually encountered a lack of food for her pigs. So when she learned about Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc., she was very happy because this organization will help her in growing her pigs.

She is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy enough feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She knows it could provide better nourishment to her pigs; that will give her a higher income. This would be a big help to her in financing the education of her five children. 

At the age of 42, she is still hopeful to uplift her family from poverty through her hard work and strong determination. Hopefully, their pain will end and they will overcome the poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy enough feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 10 children. 

Alan has a corn field and vegetable garden that allows him to sell corn grains and vegetables in due time. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for the corn field and vegetable garden.

Alan is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field and vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with four children. 

Bonifacio has a vegetable garden from which he sells vegetables like eggplants and string beans in due time. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Bonifacio is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bonifacio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food merchandise to increase income.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, age 50, runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and it has helped to raise her family's standard of living. Before this, the family suffered the worst possible hardship: the death of Lourdes's husband, who was the breadwinner for the family. Lourdes now shoulders the responsibility to support herself and her children through her business.

Driven primarily by the determination not to restore their past suffering, Lourdes is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, candies, instant noodles, and soft drinks. She is confident that this will provide a higher income in order to improve their living conditions.

Even with the head of the household now gone, Lourdes intends to lift her family from poverty through sacrifice and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, candies, instant noodles, and soft drinks

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn, age 29, raises pigs to earn a living. She is a high school graduate, but she was not able to enter college due to the poverty of her parents. She and her husband have three small children. None of them are yet studying, but Sherlyn is driven to work hard so as to be able to support their education. She is determined to provide for them to be educated beyond the high school level.

Since she wants to save for her children, she is asking for additional working capital amounting to PhP 5,000 in order to buy piglets and feed. She is confident that this will allow her to earn a higher profit during the selling season and set more funds aside for future use. 

Sherlyn's children are her inspiration and her motivation for working hard. She is determined to uplift the family's living conditions and to provide herself and her children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigletS and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more medicine to increase income.

loans.name: Ma. Katrina

texts.en:
Ma. Katrina married early, so she needs to work and earn money for her two children. She has been operating a hog fattening business for three months. Somehow, through this work, they cover their everyday expenses. She wants to improve her business, and that's why she is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy one hog and feed. 


At the age of 23, she must make sacrifices because there is no one else to care for and watch over her children except her. Her husband is currently working in another country as an Overseas Filipino Worker. Hopefully, with their joint force of working, they will manage to sustain all the needs of their children. They might also experience progress through their hardship.

loans.use: to buy one hog and feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and blessed with four children. She presently residing at Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental.

Teresita sells a variety of products like vinegar, salt, soy sauce, eggs, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for a year. She has a net income of Php 3000 monthly.Her business helps a lot in her family; all she wants today is to expand it well so she can earn more.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy additional goods to sell. The loan will help her buy what she needs. Her dream is to buy more land to be able to produce more and solve her problems.

In her free time she likes to walk and work some extra hours.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional basic goods to sell.

loans.name: Terimbere Muhinzi 52 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Félicien fait partie du groupe Terimbere Muhinzi 52 / RSZ et sur la photo est celui qui a l’argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « may you develop yourself, farmer ! ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 49 ans. Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 4 à 21 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de primaire. 

Félicien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Dans les prochaines années, Félicien voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en: Félicien (the man in the picture holding the money) is part of the Terimbere Muhinzi 52 / RSZ group. The name of the group means "May you develop yourself, farmer!". Félicien was born in Rwanda and is 49 years old. He is married with 8 children aged between 4 and 21, all of whom go to school. He completed 2 years of primary school, and is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB and he will use the money to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farm. In the next few years, he hopes to be harvesting large amounts of rice and he plans to use the profits from his business to take care of his children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Virgilio has a pigpen and he sells grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.

Virgilio is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Virgilio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is a 53-year-old married man with three children. He is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He grows rice and sells his harvest in his community. Aside from rice farming, Jessie also raises pigs and runs an ice-cream business. Jessie works hard to improve his income and support his family. He requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed and ingredients for ice-cream. Jessie hopes to succeed in all his ventures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed and ingredients for ice-cream.

loans.name: Chepkirui

texts.en:
Chepkirui, age 33, earns a living through two businesses: tailoring and farming. She has been active in farming for the past seven years, and her farm produces tea and milk. She and her husband live in Litein South Rift, Kenya, with their four children, who are aged between 10 and 14. The three older children are enrolled in school.

Chepkirui has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES. With the loan funds, she will use KES 30,000 to purchase birds for a poultry farming venture, and use KES 20,000 to plant nappier grass and to pay farmhands to till and weed it. The nappier grass feeds her dairy cows, and she will also sell it to local dairy farmers. She says scarcity of animal feed has made nappier grass marketable and the income will help her meet her family's basic needs.

Chepkirui says that inadequacy of farming skills is the main challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To  purchase poultry and to grow nappier grass for feeding her dairy cows

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар житель Яванского района. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Он предоставляет услугу, занимается монтажом и дизайном видеокассет и дисков. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения видеокамеры.
texts.en: Anvar lives in the Yavan district.  He is 23 years old, single.  He lives together with his parents.  Anvar provides a service of video editing and design of video cassette and disks.  He has been in this business for five years.  Anvar is requesting this loan for the purchase of a video camera.

loans.use: to buy a video camera

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, age 34, raises hogs. Her husband is a farmer, and they help each other to support themselves and their two school-aged children. Her goal is to provide a good quality of life for her children. She believes that by providing for their educational needs, she can help them to succeed. “Education is the root of success," Wilma tells us, and this is why she is doing her best to see her children through until the end of their schooling. 

Even though she is often exhausted from hard work, Wilma remains strong and determined to work. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her current hogs. She is confident that this will contribute to the further growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 40 years old and married to a responsible man who is a farmer in their community. The couple is blessed with two children who are currently studying. To earn a higher income every month, Mary Jane engaged herself in hog raising business as a help to her husband. She earns about P1,500 every time she sells a mature pig and uses the money for their daily expenses such as food. She wants to boost her usual income, and this guided her to request a loan amount of P5,000 to purchase hogs, feed and vitamins. Hopefully she will be able to save for her family especially for the educational purposes of her children. In the future, she can provide a better and more financially stable life for the family.

loans.use: to purchase hogs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 51 years old, married and lives in village of Ilagan, province of Isabela. It is located in a rural area. The area is known for trade, farming and tourism.

Merlita has been a beautician for four years, providing manicures, pedicures and cutting hair. She has a loyal clientele because of her good service. She spends her income on personal expenditures.

Merlita applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy materials and tools that she needs to continue to provide good service. Thanks to her larger clientele she will be able to pay off the loan and have an even more successful business. Merlita is a hard-working and dedicated woman whose only wish is to expand her business and provide financial support to her family.

loans.use: to buy scissors, nail cutters, nail polish and nail color for her business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marisa has a shop that sells clothing like T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ichinnorov

texts.en:
Ichinnorov is 57 years old and lives with her husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is on disability pension. She used to work as a tailor at the local fashion center from 1978 to 1998. She retired from the work after 20 years and then established her own business. 

Currently she is working at her home and making clothes. She has many regular customers. She is planning to have a workplace to expand her business operation. She is an open-minded and diligent woman who says "It is getting difficult to sew clothes at home. If I had my own workplace, it would be easy to attract more customers and make more clothes." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to expand her business operation and to rent a workplace.

loans.use: To rent a workplace.

loans.name: Sanny

texts.en:
Sanny is an industrious woman. She just finished high school and didn’t finish her tertiary studies due to financial problems. They were six siblings of their parents. When she was twelve, her mother died due to severe sickness (complication of heart and high blood). Despite what happened, she continued to pursue her studies until she finished her high school.


After high school, she went to Manila to work in factory and earn money for her family. She stayed there for nine years and there she met her husband in the person of William, a farmer in their community. So, she went with her loving husband back to their province and built her small sari-sari (variety) store.


Presently, she is 53 years old, a mother of one child and asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy canned goods, candies and instant noodles as additional goods to sell. She hopes this will boost her income in order to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies and instant noodles as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old, married, and her husband works hence producing some additional income for the family. She is a mother of three school-going children aged 19 to 13 years.


She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for five years. Right now her monthly income is KES 9,100. She is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000 which she plans to use to buy sweets, maize flour, and soft drinks for sale.


She plan to invest back the profit into the  business. This is her third loan and her hopes and dreams are to continue with her retail shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy sweets, maize flour, and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more seeds and fertilizer and garden tools.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Isidora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads & beverages. She has had this business for 22 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Isidora has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Relyn

texts.en:
Relyn is 26 years old and for 10 years already has been selling "taho" (a Philippine snack food sold by peddlers). This was taught her by her parents; she inherited the trade. Within nine years duration of walking a distance selling "taho", she concludes that, as long as you are dealing in this occupation with persistence, you can lift your life from poverty.


So, she is working patiently to establish a comfortable life for her family, especially for her two children. She wants to improve her "taho" business, and that’s why she is asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy soya, silky, soft and hard tofu, bean curd skin, soybean paste, and soy ice cream as ingredients needed for her business. 


She wants to sell a delicious yet affordable "taho" in order to acquire a higher target market to produce also a higher income. This will uplift their poor living from the hardship of life, and especially she will be able to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soya, silky, soft and hard tofu, bean curd skin, soybean paste, and soy ice cream as ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jesel

texts.en:
Jesel, age 30, is a gasoline retailer in her village. She sells her wares from her home and earns PhP 9,000 a month. She and her husband have one child, and they help each other in their goal of providing a comfortable life for their small family. 

Jesel is asking a for a loan amount of PhP 6,000 buy additional gasoline to sell. She wants to grow her gasoline business so that she can eventually afford to acquire and open her desired business in the near future: a general store business.

Jewel married very young, while still studying in high school. She began her schooling in college, but when she became pregnant she was forced to leave her studies. This caused her not to finish her tertiary education.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Mark Kristoffer

texts.en:
Mark Kristoffer is now 26 years old and married but has no children yet. He already earned a degree but, due to a lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in a hog-raising business to generate income. He has been in this business for almost 4 years and usually earns a net income of 8,000 PHP a month which he uses to satisfy their basic necessities. 

He aimed to improve this business by raising more pigs but, due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He believes that, through this loan, he will be able to acquire additional piglets to raise. He mentioned that, through patience and strong determination, he will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, vaccines and vitamins for hog raising

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children.
 
Lina is providing karaoke or videoke services and collects five pesos for every song. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the electricity spent for maintenance of the service.

Lina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity spent for maintenance of the service

loans.name: Kimmatoy

texts.ru: Кимматой проживает в районе Яван. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж и сын находятся в Российской Федерации. Сама Кимматой более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый и мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Kimmatoy lives in the Yavan district.  She is 43 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband and son are in the Russian Federation.  Kimmatoy has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  She breeds cattle and small livestock at home.  She is requesting this loan for purchase of two heads of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep and 5 lambs

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Hamed fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « mettons ensemble ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 50 ans. Il est marié avec 7 enfants de 7 à 16 ans, dont 7 scolarisés. 

Hamed est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer une bonne qualité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Hamed voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hamed is part of the "Twibumbirehamwe / RSZ" group. The name of the group means "get together". Hamed was born in Rwanda 50 years ago and is married with 7 children aged between 7 and 16, all of whom go to school. 

Hamed is a rice farmer and this is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farm. He plans to grow his business over the next few years by planting good quality rice and harvesting large quantities of produce. He will use his profits to take care of his children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Balt

texts.en:
Balt is 23 years old and lives with his parents in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt or tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His mother is retired and his father works at Shim-Us LLC. Balt also works at Hoton-Uzuur LLC as an assistant clerk.

He plans to start a new business, a taxi service. When his work load is less at Hoton-Uzuur LLC, he plans to drive a taxi to earn additional income. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for a taxi service.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Myrna has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram and sacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel, age 42, is a graduate of midwifery studies, but because of the poor income of her parents, she could not afford to take a licensure examination for midwifery. She still works in a private clinic part time, but her income every month is insufficient for supporting her family. As a result, she has to sew clothing as an additional source of income. 
 
She is asking for a loan amount of PhP 5,000 to buy fabric, yarn, and needles for sewing.

She is determined that through tailoring and diligence she can send her three children all the way through school. The family currently suffers hardship, but she is certain that by providing for a full education for her children, she will help them not to suffer such difficulties in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric, yarn, and needles for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and farming tools

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita, age 36, has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Avon and Natasha. She has had this business for three years. 

Lucita and her husband have eight children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000 in order to buy clothing and beauty products to offer for sale in her shop. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business.

Lucita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat, age 23, sells groceries from his food store in the city of Sabirabad, where he lives. His vending location is well-known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Nijat knows his customers’ preferences and offers only high-quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about three years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. His mother is actively helps him: it was she who brought the idea of opening his own shop. 
 
Nijat is hoping to invest a loan of 1,500 AZN in additional merchandise, which will help him eventually to increase his turnover capital.  Nijat has a vision for the expansion of his trade that will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Nijat to persist, take small steps at a time toward his goal, and achieve success.

Nijat has a good client history and this will be his second loan from AqroInvest.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to offer for sale in his store

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en:
Merlito is 58 years old, married, and has five children. To support the family, he raises crops on his half-hectare plot of land. Merlito plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders in the village. He usually earns a yield of P20,000.

He wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy the inputs, such as fertilizers and pesticides, to ensure good crop production and to earn a better yield every harvest season.

He wants to keep growing as an entrepreneur and somehow help lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Romana, who is in her late 20's, is married and has a small child. She has had a fruits and vegetables business for two years now.  She works from  7 a.m to  11 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   She wants to use it for buying more fruits and vegetables to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a big retail shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Protea", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy winter clothes for resale.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, 61, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Pacifico and mother to their three children. 

She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Magdalena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every day. She also earns additional income from room rentals in her house.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 33,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Magdalena hopes to add rice grains in her store and prays to God for her family to always be in good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Aiymbubu's Group

texts.en:
Aiymbubu is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a small village near to Isykul Lake. Aiymbubu and her husband are retirees. In order to earn additional money she sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. In this way she earns an additional 1,500 KGS per month. She started this activity two years ago. 

Aiymbubu is applying for the loan because she needs money to contribute some to her grandson’s wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to contribute money to her grandson's wedding.

loans.name: Avec Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
Mélanie is the leader of the group named “Avec Dieu Plus” made up of 13 members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Mélanie, 45, is married and has six children of whom two go to school. Mélanie’s main business is selling fresh food in her area. Each day, her business brings in a profit of $20. She has been a micro entrepreneur since 2006. She likes her business and she is working hard to achieve her goal of one day opening a general store. 

She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received ten loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to purchase additional goods to resell with the aim of increasing her profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her business for resale at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a resident and a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is married and has three children between 10 and 6 years old. He has been in active farming for 12 years with his produce of milk and tea being sold to the local market. He gets additional income from his motorcycle transport business.

Johana has made a first loan request of 26,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure an additional dairy cow. He says the cow will boost his dairy income and enable him meet his family needs more easily. He remains optimistic about the dairy business.

Johana says his challenges are that farmers lack capital and markets for farm produce are poor.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Moisari

texts.en:
