Moisari is 28 years old. He is married and a father of one child. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, and he is planning to use the money to prepare his wheat farm. He paid his previous loans successfully. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children. 

His hope and dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a large-scale farmer. Moisari is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farming

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Aida buys and peddles fruits like green mangoes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fruits like mangoes to sell.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits like mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Albert, an employee, and is mother to their four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Aida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns additional income from selling cooked viands. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Aida hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold is 24 years old and lives with his mother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

He works as a security guard at the local legal office. Since his work has three shifts, he plans to drive a taxi during his free time and weekends to increase his income level. For this reason, he is planning to purchase a car although he has no taxi-driving experience. 

He is an open-minded and diligent man who says, "I want to have a good life. During the weekends, I prefer to drive a taxi and earn money rather than staying at home." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Oscar has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. He has had this business for two years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy dried fish for resale. Oscar has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Oscar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, age 49, runs a business selling snacks and other delicacies. She earns about PhP 2,700 each month doing this type of work. She also engages in farming. She and her husband live in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, and have one child.
 
Trinidad has requested a loan of PhP 14,900 in order to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies for the farm.
 
Trinidad has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies for the farm

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, age 59, works as a manicurist and pedicurist in her local community. She patiently walks a considerable distance every day to get to her workplace. With her scanty daily earnings, she manages to support her family. Through effort and entrepreneurship, she is determined to provide a more comfortable life for her family.

She is asking for a loan amount of PhP 5,000 in order to buy cuticle remover, acetone, nail polish, and other materials needed for providing high-quality manicure services. As a result, she will be able to attract more customers to avail her service. 

She dreams eventually of building her own beauty parlor shop in their community. Despite her age, this is the goal that motivates her to work. She is confident that this dream is within her reach.

loans.use: to buy cuticle remover, acetone, nail polish, and other materials needed for providing high-quality manicure services

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a farmer working in Sto Niño, South Cotabato. He has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. John is able to provide for his family through his income from his farm. John also has a small sari-sari store. He sells items like soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar. John works hard to improve his earnings and support his family financially. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farming materials, as well as more items to sell in his store. John hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming materials, as well as more items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 54 years old and owns a sari-sari (variety store) in her community. In the five years she has owned this business, she has been able to support the studies of her five children. She says she is thankful to our creator's help and assistance. She continues her business to provide a better living for her family. 

She is requesting a loan amount of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs and biscuits to sell in her store. These goods are a big help in acquiring a higher income each month. She wants to continue increasing her profit in order to achieve success in business. This may cause her living condition to improve.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs and biscuits to sell in her store

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig, age 43, started an automotive repair business in 1998. In 2010, he was able to purchase a new car and became a taxi driver. Since then, he has been earning a living driving his taxi. 

Ganzorig lives with his sons and wife in a "ger" (a traditional Mongolian tent domicile) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His two sons are college students. His wife sells animal raw materials.	
 
Ganzorig is an open-minded and diligent man who says, "I am doing my best to pay the tuition fees of my sons. Despite this, I have plans to open a car body shop in the future." 
 
He needs to make some necessary repairs and upgrades to his taxi. He is therefore requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase spare parts to fix his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to make essential repairs to his taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, age 36, runs a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have six children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 3,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.
  
Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 56, earns her living by making and selling bread. She earns about PhP 1,000 each month through her business. She and her husband have one child and live in Calunsan, Larena, Siquijor.

Edna has requested a loan amounting to PhP 8,000 in order to purchase ingredients for breadmaking.
 
Edna has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Edna would like expand her small business. Her goal is to ensure that her child receives a complete education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for breadmaking

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 48 year old woman who owns a motorcycle.  She is married and blessed with three children. Eden allows her nephew to use her motorcycle to earn money. They  share his income every day. Sometimes, it is very minimal profit for them so she is also accepting  laundry from their neighbors. Eden is enduring difficulties in earning money yet she is very positive. Her children serve as her inspiration to pursue life.

Since her motorcycle  is used daily, it also needs maintenance and new parts.  Eden is requesting a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to be used for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to stay strong in order to provide a better income for her family.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Loreta has a retail shop that sells umbrellas, bed sheets & clothing.  Her husband is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy umbrellas & bed sheets for sale.
Loreta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Loreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy umbrellas & bed sheets for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is a rice farmer and also raises pigs.. Josephine's husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their rice farm. Josephine focuses on raising hogs and taking care of their children. She works hard to help augment their family income. She has applied for a loan to purchase feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Josephine hopes to continue earning from their farm and small piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a mother of 9 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor. 

Edna has a small piggery  and earns PHP 1,000.00 a month. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and medicines for pig raising.

Edna has been a member of PMPC for 9 months. In the future, Edna hopes to have bigger profits to support her children especially in their school obligations.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for pigs

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Daisy has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from Avon & Natasha. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA for sale.
Daisy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA for sale

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya is 38 years old and lives with her son and husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her family rents the yurt on a monthly basis. Her husband receives a disability pension and her son is a high school student. She started her business in 2010 by selling vegetables at the Han-Ord local market. She buys the vegetables at wholesale prices and resells them at retail price. She is planning to expand her business. She is a diligent woman who says "I started my business with 60,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). I learned that things go well if they are managed well." She is requesting a loan for 500,000 MNT to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, age 31, owns and manages a variety store in the village where she lives with her husband and their only child. She has been engaged in this business for almost six years and earns a profit of PhP 13,000 a month, which she utilizes primarily for the food, clothing, and school fees of her child. 

Margie believes that "success is the fruit of hard work and poverty is the consequence of being lazy." She aims to improve the business and make it a more viable source of income so that the family's standard of living can be improved. She wants more than anything to offer her child a bright future. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 35,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, cup noodles, biscuits, and candies to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help considerably to improve the business. She hopes that through her patience and sacrifices, she can make her business grow and flourish in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, cup noodles, biscuits, and candies to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Marianeth

texts.en: Marianeth is 32 years old. She is the operator of a motorcycle and has been in this occupation for three years, working hard just to provide financial services for her family. She is blessed with three children; two of them are students. She needs to work every day to meet their needs, especially for school. Even though she works every day, she still experiences shortages due to low income. Sometimes she can't work because of problems with the motorcycle. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy paint for motorcycle maintenance and also to pay for repairs. She wants to earn a higher income to improve their unprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy paint for maintenance and also pay for repairs to her motorcycle

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, age 36,  is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, where he also carries out a taxi business. He has one farmhand. His farm produces milk which he sells to the local market. He has been in farming for 10 years.
 
Benard and his wife have three children, aged between five and 11 years old.

Benard has requested a loan in the amount of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is confident that the acquisition of the cow will boost his income and enable him to ensure the education of his children.This is his first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo.
 
He sees three major challenges in farming: insufficient capital, poor weather conditions, and scarcity of animal feeds. He is grateful to Juhudi for the support accorded to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 37, is engaged in farming along with her husband. They plant rice on their land and sell their harvest at the market. They have four children between the ages of 14 and 21.

Marilou does her best to help support her husband and children. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs. 

She is confident that investing in their farm in this way will help to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and four lambs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy is 40 years old and a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $7 per day. They have two children; one is studying and the other is working and earning $2.3 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy construction materials for her husband’s career. Before, her husband found the market of construction work very hard, but now he can have a lot of customers because the villagers know about his achievements. She wants to buy more equipment for her husband, so that he can successfully do more construction work.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband's career.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by buying some more bags of cement and reselling them at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 59 years old, and married to a faithful man in their community. The couple is blessed with four children and their youngest is currently studying. To earn an income, Aniceta engaged herself in sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful because she earns about P1,000 every day which is usually used for their daily expenses and allowances.

She wants to increase her usual income, so she requested a loan amount P5,000 to purchase bread and soft drinks as additional products to offer. Hopefully, she can save for her family especially for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase bread and soft drinks as additional products to offer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a dairy cow and one cattle.

loans.name: Newmee

texts.en: Newmee is a 33-year-old married woman with a 2-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers. They till a land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where they grow rice crops. Newmee also raises pigs in their backyard. Newmee works hard to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase feed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. Newmee hopes to be able to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe, 55-years old, and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio, a caddie boy, and mother to four children. Two are already working while the other two are still studying in high school. Fe, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Fe has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices, and then sells them at a piece rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golf players, who are her immediate customers. Aside from this, she also earns additional income from her small variety store. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Fe hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good future, and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of golf ball products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 38 years old. She is currently engaged in selling a variety of food, which she cooks and prepares every day. At first, she found it difficult to acquire customers because she was new in the business and people had not tried her foods. But as time passed, she gained loyal customers and made sales.
In order to expand her business, Ophelia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy bananas (to make bananacue, turon, banana cheaps), eggs (to be coated with flour), breads and juice. She is hoping to make a larger profit in order to be able to meet daily expenses, especially the education of her two children. She also wants to experience a comfortable life so while she is strong she is working hard every day.

loans.use: to buy bananas (to make bananacue, turon, banana cheaps), eggs (to be coated with flour), breads and juice.

loans.name: Rosemar

texts.en:
Rosemar is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 
Rosemar provides a motorcycle, or habal-habal, service. He has run this business for three years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay for gasoline to run the motorcycle.
Rosemar is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Nouen

texts.en:
Nouen (pictured here in the pink shirt) is 30 years old. She makes and sells baskets to earn a living. Her income is $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns an income of $2.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying and working. Every month, Noren spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $400 to buy a motorcycle in order to transport her baskets to offer them for sale. This loan will help her to be able to bring her baskets to other provinces where she can get higher prices than when she is limited to selling them in her own village. 

Her goal is to enable both her children to continue their education through university level.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to transport her baskets to offer them for sale in other provinces

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, age 59, is engaged in preparing and selling macaroni soup as well as mikki and pancit, which are popular local stir-fried noodle dishes. She cooks these dishes fresh every day and has a place in the school where she sells her prepared foods. She is highly skilled in her occupation after 30 years of experience, and she is able to send her three children to school with her earnings of of PhP 500 per day.
  
She now wants to grow her business, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to buy vegetables, meat, macaroni, and the ingredients for mikki and pancit. She also wants to add soft drinks to her offerings, since there is high demand among her customers for beverages to consume after a meal. She is confident that this will allow her to increase her target market and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, macaroni, and the ingredients for mikki and pancit, as well as adding soft drinks to her offerings

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 24 years old. Ofelia does rice farming and raises hogs to earn a living. She helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. She also raises pigs in their backyard. Ofelia works hard to help provide for their needs and send their children to school.

Ofelia has requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ofelia hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 53, runs a retail shop that sells gasoline per liter. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have five children.

She has requested a loan for PhP 5,000 in order to buy gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.
 
Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one calf as well as items to stock in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one calf

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, 61 years old, would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a threshing machine to thresh other farmers' fields so that she can make some income from it. She is getting older now, so she can’t do the farming any more. She can run her new career of renting a threshing machine to villagers, because she doesn’t need to do this work herself. 

Sorn is a farmer earning $1 per day. She is a single mother and lives with three children. All of them are working; each earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

loans.use: to buy a threshing machine for threshing other farmers' fields

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She earns a living through farming. Renita grows and sells rice in her community. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs and send her children to school. Renita's goal is to have all her children finish college.

Renita has requested a loan to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes this loan will help grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, age 31, is a farmer from Litein, South Rift, Kenya. She has been farming for 8 years, producing milk, onions and tea for the local market. She is married with three children. The first two are already in school. She mentions lack of farming capital as the main challenge for farmers.

Emily has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a poultry farming venture. She says this will help boost her farming income and help her meet family's needs more easily and uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Renante

texts.en: Renante is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Renante has been providing motorcycle or habal-habal services for the past five years. He is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools for motorcycle maintenance and pay for gasoline. Renante is a new member of HSPFI. He hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools for motorcycle maintenance and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Humar

texts.en: Humar is 40 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His four children are high school students. His wife helps him with his business. He started his business in 2007 by serving in the public transportation as a mini-van driver. He works 15 days each month. He is planning to fix his current mini-van. He is a sharp-minded and diligent man who says, "I like my job and I know that this is my only source of income. I am planning to buy a new mini-van again in the future." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase tires and other spare parts for his mini-van.

loans.use: to purchase tires and make vehicle repairs

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa manages a variety store in her village to supplement her husband's income and help pay for daily needs. She is now 55 years old and has four adult children. Felisa and her husband aimed to improve their standard of living to give their children a better future. Despite the hardships of life, she pursue the business for she believes that hardships and difficulties are the stepping stone towards success. 
Felisa wants to increase the product offerings in her store to satisfy her customers' needs but she has insufficient capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She hopes that this loan will do much to help make her business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is a 47-year-old garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns $1 per day. They have three children, all of whom are working, earning $2 per day each. Every month, Nam has to spend $55 on food, $10 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. Nam would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for use in the family. 
Nam wants to embark on a new career that her husband also can share. In this way, they will be able to improve their family income. Nam doesn’t know what that new career will be until she completes this loan and has some start-up money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for use in the family.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a caddie boy, and is the mother of four children. Three of her children are already working while the youngest is still studying in school. Together with her husband, Pacita manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
Pacita has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them at a piece rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golf players, who are her immediate customers. Aside from this, she also earns additional income from a small variety store. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Pacita is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Pacita hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of golf balls.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Chanthorn is a 28-year-old housewife. Her husband transports soil to sell, and earns $10 per day. Chanthorn lives with her parents and one brother. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $9 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a hand tractor to plow her field and plow the villagers' fields to earn some money. She plans to rent a small store in the market to sell some grocery goods so that she can help her husband to earn money.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor to plow her field.

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
В этот раз Роман изъявил желание воспользоваться кредитом, так как предвидел рост цен и решил закупить товар заранее, по более низкой цене. На кредитные средства Роман приобрел муку, сахар, соль, макароны, майонез, консервы рыбные, чай кофе и др. продукты для реализации.

За счет предыдущего кредита Роман смог расширить ассортимент своей продукции и увеличить прибыль. Роман ценит полученные кредиты и считает недопустимым опаздывать с выплатами даже на один день.
texts.en: This time, Roman expressed his desire to obtain a loan because he had anticipated an increase in prices and decided to purchase merchandise in advance, at lower prices.  He used the funds from the loan to purchase flour, sugar, salt, pasta, mayonnaise, canned fish, tea, coffee and other products for sale.  Using the previous loan, Roman was able to expand the assortment of his products and increase his profits.  Roman values the loans he obtained and considers it unacceptable to be late on payments even by one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories at low prices

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 45 years old, widowed, and has three children, ranging in age from 11 to 30.  When Fatma requested her first loan, she was newly separated from her husband and living in her neighbor’s wooden shed with her six-year-old son.  Neighbors suggested that she should take a loan from Maya to open up new possibilities for her future.  

Fatima's life has changed since meeting with a Maya loan officer.  She was accepted into a group and received a loan for $450.  With a small part of the loan she found a small place to rent and bought some furniture and other household items.  With the remaining money, she went to Istanbul and bought some loose beads and some things for the bohça trade (usually cheaply made pajamas, clothes, table clothes, etc. that are wrapped up a cloth and carried on one’s back to sell around the neighborhoods).  Sometimes Fatima took her bohça on her back to make sales and sometimes she made prayer beads from the loose beads she had bought and sold them at mosques and on street corners.  She repaid her first loan and requested another.  With her second loan she bought more items for the bohça trade.

On the days she was not out selling, Fatima was planting and raising vegetable seedling in an unused garden spot next to her house.  She took the seedlings and started to sell them at the local bazaar.  She saw that she could earn more money raising vegetable seedlings.  She repaid her second loan.  For her third through fifth loans she concentrated on expanding the areas where she could raise seedlings and planted produce to sell in the bazaar.  Her business was going so well that during this time she built a house, bought a vehicle to transport her expanding seedling and produce supplies to the bazaar, and hired a seasonal worker.   

With her sixth loan, Fatima will continue to expand her business using the loan to rent additional fields, buy seeds, fertilizer, watering supplies, and materials for a greenhouse. Fatma’s life has changed a lot.  She is now a free and happy woman.

In the future, Fatima wants to rent other fields and upgrade her vehicle. She also hopes to own her own fields, so she won’t have to rent but can have her own land and production, and travel to holy places.  She wants her son to be successful in school, his work and make investments for their retirement.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Fatma Hanım 45 yaşında ve dul.  Fatma Hanım'ın 3 çocuğu var.  En küçüğü 11,en büyüğü 30 yaşında.
Fatma hanım kredi kullanmaya başladığında çok çaresizdi.  Eşinden yeni ayrılmış ve komşunun tahtadan yaptığı barakada yaşıyordu,altı yaşında bir çocuğu vardı.  Komşuları Maya'yı önermiş borç para al, yaşamının önünü açarsın demişler.  Bu durumda bana kim borç verir,vermezler demiş.  Ancak maya saha sorumlusuyla karşılaşınca hayatı değişmiş,başvurusu kabul edilmiş.  Grup kredisiyle 750 TL borç almış.  Küçük bir kısmıyla ev kiralamış,eski eşya satanlardan çocuğunun ve kendisinin yatabileceği ve oturabileceği iki kanepe alıp yaşayabilecekleri alanı sağladı,kalan parasıyla İstanbul'a gidip,biraz boncuk,birazda bohça malı aldı.  Bazen bohçasını sırtına alıp satış yaptı,bazende boncuklardan ürettiği tesbihleri cami ve yol kenarlarında sattı ve borcunu ödedi.  Bir kredi daha talep etti.  Kredisini alıp bohça malı alıp sattı.  Satışa çıkmadığı günlerde,evinin yanında boş olan bahçede denemek için sebze fidesi ekti.  Fideleri pazara çıkarıp sattı.Gördü ki bu iş daha fazla para kazandırıyor.Maya'ya borcu da bitti.  Bir kredi daha alarak,bahçe kiralayıp fide üreticiliğine başladı.  Fideleri pazara çıkarıp satar,kendince iyi para kazanır.Kendisine ev yapmaya karar verir.Evet şimdi kendi evinde oturmaktadır.Kredi borcu bitmiştir.Tekrar kredi alır ve yine fide eker,yanında mevsimlik işçi çalışmaktadır artık.  Fideleri pazara götürmek için arabaya ihtiyacı vardır ve 2.yıl fide geliriyle kendisini taşıyabilecek düzeyde bir araba alır.  Artık arabası da vardır.Fatma Hanım'ın hayatı çok ama çok değişti.  O artık özgür ve mutlu bir kadın.
Fatma Hanım aldığı bu kredi ile kiraladığı tarlanın bakımı,fide tohumları,gübreleme,sulama malzemesi,sera muşambası gibi üretim için gerekli malzeme almak istiyor.Bu kredi ile bir tarla daha kiralama fırsatı olacak,arabasını yeniliyecek.Belki kendi tarlası olacak,kiralama yerine kendi yerinde üretim yapacak.Bir hayalide umreye gitmek,gezmek.Oğlunu okutuyor ,başarılı olduğunu düşünüyor.İyi okullarda okumasını ve iyi iş sahibi olmasını istiyor. Yaşlılığına yatırım yapıyor.Yeniliğe açık,girişken,mücadeleci.

loans.use: to purchase the materials for planting seedlings and growing produce.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City where, to earn a living, she has a business selling canned goods, softdrinks, sugar, milk, milo, cigarettes, vinegar, silver swan, etc. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month.

A member of PMPC for 2 years, Judy has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional stocks for her general store, and in the future would like to have a grocery store. Judy is an honest person who is proud to be a member of PMPC because of the financial help they provide.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
From Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Mrs. Men is a 49-year-old widowed woman who has earned a living by planting rice crops and potatoes with her son for many years in their existing farm. Besides this, Mrs. Men has also operated a small business in her village as a tailor for clothes made of both modern cloth and traditional cloth. She always has a lot of clients come to her store in order to send their cloth for sewing as they need. From this business, Mrs. Men could generate an income of approximately $2.50 USD each day to cover her daily expenses. 

Recently, her potatoes are not growing well because they are ravaged by insects and lawn. Because of that obstacle, Mrs. Men has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide which she will use to protect her crop and also hire domestic laborers to cut down lawn. In the future, Mrs. Men hopes she is able to get a better standard of living, decorate her old house and send her son to be educated in a university degree.

loans.use: to buy insecticide to protect her crop and hire domestic laborers to cut down lawn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two baby calves.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren, who is 47 years old and lives with her children, both college students, in an apartment in the Hovd Province of Mongolia, started her business in 2003 by selling home appliances at the local market. She brings in most of her products from the Mongolian western border, and her business is free from seasonal fluctuations and thus profitable on a constant basis.

An open-minded person, Byambasuren says, "The months of September and October are for marriage and other celebrations. So, the demand for home appliances is very high. I want to sell as many products as possible." Byambasuren is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrik loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like maize flour, sugar, salt, beans, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en: Munhbayar is 38 years old and lives with his daughters and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His daughters are high school students. His wife makes traditional Mongolian shoes during the winter times and they sell animal hides at other times. He supports his wife's business on a daily basis. He believes that he will gain much deep work experience in a short time. He started his family business, making Mongolian traditional shoes in 2007 at his home. He is very encouraged with the profits and results he has realized from this business. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says "The bank loan was very important to expand and improve my business. In the near future, I plan to open my own shoe factory." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal hides to sell in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: To purchase more animal hides

loans.name: Baby Ruth

texts.en:
This is Baby Ruth, 41, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Epifanio, a overseas contract worker. They have four children, two in college while the others are still in high school and elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Baby Ruth operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a Php 29,000 loan. She will use it to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as it expands. 

Baby Ruth hopes to renovate her house in the province and dreams to be able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer units, spare parts and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is a 31-year-old local cultivator who resides of Ornlong Veng district of Seim Reap province. Nam has a life partner in her husband who also works in the same business. This family normally earns an average of $5USD per day. 

Nam and her husband are blessed with two children who are attending a local public school. Presently, this family lives in a narrow house and some parts of it are broken down. It is so hard for them to live in. They really need to buy a new house which is bigger than current house, but their cash on hand is not sufficient to purchase one. 

To solve the problem, Nam would like to request a loan to purchase a new house. With this loan, it will allow her and her family members to live a comfortable life. In the future, Nam plans to enlarge her fertile farm in order to get more profit, have a well-organized house for her own family as well as sending her children at least to high school level.

loans.use: to purchase a new house.

loans.name: Sy-Sikasso-01223 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA au nombre de 4 sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 37 ans,  3 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames dans la  ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait diverses activités telles, l’alimentaire, l’habillement et les prestations de services.
AMI, en boubou bleu foncé fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  60kg de poissons soit 25kg de poissons frais et 35 kg de poissons fumés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché de Hamdallaye de la ville  de Sikasso, et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The "Danaya" group is composed of 4 married women with an average age of 37 years and on average 3 children, who live in polygamous families in the town of Sikasso. This will be their twelfth loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and they are requesting it in order to be able to invest in their businesses so that they can satisfy customer demand. All their previous loans have been fully repaid. The 4 women are all active in different areas including food, clothing and the supply of various services.

Ami, wearing the navy blue dress, sells fish. She will use her part of the loan to buy 60 kgs of fish (25 kgs of fresh fish and 35 kgs of smoked fish). She gets her supplies in the Grand Market of Sikasso and, together with her family, resells them from a fixed location at the Hamdallaye market in Sikasso, for cash. She predicts an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, some of which she will use to repay her loan, the rest of which she plans to save. She would like to increase her revenues so that she can re-invest in her business and increase her level of customer service.

loans.use: to buy smoked and fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fruit like mangoes to sell. Cecilia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits like mangoes to sell

loans.name: Lucero, Mecel Group

texts.en: Mecel is single but she had a live-in partner with 2 children. She is 24 years old and lives in Luy-a, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Mecel has sold vegetables for three years and has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizer. She has been a member of PMPC for less than two months and in the future hopes to have a better income. Mecel is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.  Ronald has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. He has had this business for a year. 

He requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional rice to sell.  Ronald is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ronald hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella, 58, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Angelo, her business partner, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Estrella operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. She also earns additional income from room rental payments in her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estrella hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be with her Relatives in Canada. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sanjragchaa

texts.en: Sanjragchaa is 66 years old and lives his wife in an apartment in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife sews and makes clothes. He is retired and in pension at the moment. His family started a tailoring business in 2002. He supports his wife in every aspect that is related to the family business. His family is planning to expand their business operation and build a house. He is a diligent and hard working man who says "With the bank loan, I want to develop and improve my business to a certain degree. I and my wife are planning to open a tailoring house in our hometown." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sewing materials for their business and to complete the construction of a new house.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FOTEMOGOBAN est constitué de 4 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. Les prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
MAYAMA KADIATOU, qui fait le commerce de bois de chauffe, est la première assise à droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 chargements de charrette d’âne en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente dans son  quartiers à Banconi  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The "Fotemogoban" group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 38 and, on average, 5 children, and who mostly live in polygamous families in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are now on their eighth loan cycle with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso and are requesting the loan in order to invest in their businesses so that they can satisfy customer demand. All their previous loans have been fully repaid.

Kadiatou, on the far right of the picture, sells firewood. She will use her part of the loan to buy 7 donkey cart loads worth of firewood. She gets her supplies in the villages around Sikasso and, together with her family, resells the wood in her local district of Banconi. The wood is ordered by her customers who pay for it in cash. She predicts an average monthly profit of around 37 500 francs, some of which she will use to repay the loan and interest, the rest of which she plans to save. She would like to increase her revenues so that she can re-invest in her business and increase her level of customer service.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: La cliente Musoka, leader du groupe d’affaire «Mapatano », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un Evangéliste Pasteur  dans une église locale de la pentecôte. Elle est  sociétaire d’un atelier de couture. Elle s’installe dans un atelier proche de son domicile à Ndosho. Il y a 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ce petit métier générateur de revenus à son ménage. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Son fonds de démarrage fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  quelques matériels de couture (15 mètres de tissus, files, dentelles, mordorés, modelage, ciseaux, etc.).  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Musoka is the leader of the "Mapatano" business group. She is a 40-year-old entrepreneur, married and the mother of 6 young children, all of whom go to school. Her husband is an evangelical minister for the local Pentecostal church. Musoka is a member of a sewing workshop located near her home in Ndosho, and has been earning money for her household in this way for 7 years. Her husband provided her with her start-up capital and she has since successfully completed 9 loan cycles with Hekima. She is requesting a new loan which she will use to buy sewing materials (15 meters of fabric, thread, lace, patterns, scissors, etc.). She wants to watch her children grow up comfortably and expand her business. Musoka would like to thank Hekima for helping underprivileged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials (15 meters of fabric, thread, lace, patterns, scissors, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 46, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a driver, and is mother to their four children. Two are already working while one is still studying in college and one in high school. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of  500 Philippine Pesos (PHP)in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mae Joy

texts.en:
Mae Joy is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.   Mae Joy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Mae Joy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mae Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru:
Ганна решила взять этот кредит чтобы расширить ассортимент осеннего товара. 
Она распродала большую часть обуви и решила перейти на торговлю женской одеждой. Также она смогла арендовать еще одну точку на базаре и поставить туда наемного работника.
За время пользования предыдущим кредитом Ганна смогла сделать небольшой ремонт в доме - покраска и поклейка обоев. Также в семье произошло особое событие - сын Ганны женился и переехал жить отдельно от родителей.
texts.en: Ganna decided to take out this loan to expand her fall clothing inventory. She has already sold most of the shoes and decided to branch out to sell women's clothing. She has also been able to rent a second stall at the market and has hired a sales person for it. Since her last loan Ganna has also done repairs to her house - they painted and hung new wallpaper. Also, there was a big event in her family - Ganna's son got married and has moved out to live separately from his parents.

loans.use: to purchase cardigans and long sleeve blouses, fall slacks and skirts.

loans.name: Naftary

texts.en:
Naftary is a farmer in Muranga, Central Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years. He is aged 50 and married, with 4 children.  Three of the children are grown.  He currently employs two farmhands who help him in producing milk and tea for the local market.

Naftary has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He hopes to be able to increase his milk output to over 30 litres per day.  He says the dairy cow will help him meet his household needs and educate the children. 

He says the escalating cost of animal feeds remains the major challenge in farming.  He adds that farmers have a lot of help from Juhudi Kilmo loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, le prêt passé a été correctement remboursé. 
AMINATA, à gauche en tenue noire, fait le commerce de friperies. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 balles de friperie. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle revend à une place fixe au marché du quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville  de Sikasso, de façon ambulante à travers sa fille et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The "Sabougnouma" group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 33 years and, on average, 4 children, and who mainly live in monogamous families in the town of Sikasso. This will be their second loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and they are requesting it in order to be able to invest in their businesses so that they can satisfy their customers' needs. Their previous loan was fully repaid.

Aminata, on the left of the picture, in the black outfit, sells second-hand clothes, and she will use her part of the loan to get 3 bales of used clothing. She gets her merchandise at the Grand Market of Sikasso and, together with her family, resells it from a fixed location at the Hamdallaye market in Sikasso, for cash. Her daughter also sells the clothes on the street. Aminata predicts an average monthly profit of 17 250 francs, some of which she will use to repay her loan, the rest of which she plans to save.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim was born in 1962. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, Duc Tu commune. She is married, with two children who go to school. Her husband is a carpenter. He has income. Mrs Kim is a farmer. Her main job is growing rice and breeding the pigs and poultry. Her family has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 vietnamdong(VND). 

Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy wood for her husband to produce furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband to produce furniture

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Aida has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods, breads & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages .
Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn, age 25, earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Orn is married to Pao who is also age, 25. This couple earns a profit of around $4.20 USD each day in order to feed their two young kids and to meet their needs. 

Her husband’s daily work is to cut and collect firewood from the forest nearby and then transport it to sell in a local market. Orn’s husband always uses his trailer to pick up his firewood to sell it but it was broken. It may affect his business activity as he doesn’t have vehicle to transport his goods. As they have insufficient funds, Orn and her husband have decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a new trailer. They will be using part of the loan to buy more firewood for processing in their firewood business. In the future, Orn hopes that she can rebuild her existing house in bigger size. 
Note: In this photograph, Orn was taken with her two children.

loans.use: to purchase a new trailer.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Maïmouna est agée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux  et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire dans la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Maïmouna a mené beaucoup d’activités mais sans réussite, c’est ainsi  qu’elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’ achat et  de vente d’habillements et  de bijoux : des pagnes wax, des tissus brodés, des colliers en chaines, des boucles d’oreilles, des bracelets, etc. depuis plus de six ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso ( au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de leur quartiers, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Ce deuxième prêt individuel, elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax, 5 complets de tissus brodés et 10 paquets de colliers en chaines et 10 paquet de boucle d’oreilles.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is 50 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Maïmouna started trading in clothing and jewellery over 6 years ago, after several failed business ventures. She sells items like wax pagnes, embroidered fabrics, chain necklaces, earrings and bracelets, and she gets her merchandise in the town of Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She then resells it on the street, mostly to women, and is much in demand due to the good quality of her products.

In order to be able to satisfy increasing customer demand, Maïmouna joined the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago and, after several group loans taken out with fellow members of a neighbourhood association, is now on her second individual loan. All her previous loans have been fully repaid. She will use her loan money to buy 10 Wax Pagnes, 5 embroidered suits, 10 packets of chain necklaces and 10 packets of earrings. She predicts an average monthly income of 90 000 francs, part of which she will use to contribute to her family´s expenses and repay her loan interest, part of which she will reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to restock on merchandise for resale.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You is 30-years-old. She is a married woman who has nine lovely children. Four of her children are married and live independently and the other five live with her. Presently, she has a business as a vegetable planter. She has been in this industry for many years. From this business activity she earns about $2 for each day. 

She is a resident of Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. For advancing her livelihood, she would like to purchase farmland but she is lacking some fund so she wishes to apply for a loan from lenders. She hopes that all donors will provide this loan to her soon. The loan will provide her support in meeting her financial needs and improving the quality of the product and her agricultural activities. 

She characterizes herself as an honest woman, honorable and very responsible, prompt with her payments. Her hopes in the future are that she will send the last born-child to earn a university degree and she wishes to have a comfortable house. This is her first loan with Kiva and the second cycle with Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh was born in 1971. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, in the Duc Tu commune. She is married and has three children. Her family has a workshop in which she has been working for many years with the help of her husband, who is a carpenter.  They have an income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per month. She has been involved with SEDA since 2006, and always repays her loans punctually. This is her 6th loan cycle. She is borrowing 8,502,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture to sell

loans.name: Irenea Group

texts.en: Irenea is married with 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Mahayag.  She has been selling dried fish to earn a living for the past 3 years, and earns PHP 4,000 each month.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.  Irenea has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Stephen Vincent

texts.en: Stephen Vincent is 24 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. For the past 2 years he has been running a transportation business, providing motorela and habal-habal services. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline and maintenance.  He is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline and maintenance

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 52, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Candido, a technician.  Of her five children, four are already working, while the youngest is in college. By the grace of God, she has managed to support all her children's educational needs. As of the present time she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her youngest child’s college education.

Corazon operates an appliances-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician, while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair and check-up of all types of appliances, like electric fans, washing machines, air-conditioners and others. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts of appliances. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts of appliances needed in her business

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe BENKELEMA sont majoritairement des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à LOULOUNI (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont bien dénoués.
BARKE, fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires dans ce groupe femmes BENKELEMA, elle est la première à droite avec un pagne blanc au cou. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  50kg de sel gemme, 2 cartons de cube Maggi, 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile alimentaires et 3 paquets d’oignon séchées. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Sikasso ville et effectue sa vente en détail, dans sa famille au quartier BOBOKIN et les jours de foire, au marché de la ville de LOULOUNI, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant souvent à crédit . 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKELEMA are married women for the most part who average 36 years of age and three children each. They live mostly in polygamous families in Loulouni (third administrative region of Mali).

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the tenth time to meet the needs of their customers. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

BARKE sells food condiments. A member of BENKELEMA, she is first from the right in the photo, wrapped in a white shawl.

She will use her loan to buy 50 kg of salt, two boxes of Maggi broth cubes, one 20-liter can of cooking oil, and three packages of dried onion. She gets her merchandise in Bamako and Sikasso. She conducts her sales at retail, among family members in the district of BOBOKIN, and also on fair days at the Loulouni market, to a clientele composed mainly of women, and mostly for cash but occasionally on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 37,250FCFA, part of which will be used to pay the loan and interest, and the rest added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy food condiments for resale

loans.name: Xam

texts.en: Xam was born in 1966. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, in the Duc Tu commune. She has two children. Her husband works in Da Hoi. Mrs Xam is a carpenter, and has a workshop where she has been working for many years. Her family has a monthly income of about 8,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She wants to have a better life, so she is always trying to earn more money. She has been involved with SEDA since 2006. This is her 6th loan cycle. She is borrowing 8,502,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture to sell

loans.name: C9239 Huguka Ukore Group

texts.en:
Ereda is the leader of a group called “Haguruka Ukore”, which has a total of six members, each with a different business. Ereda owns a small general store which sells different kinds of fruits.  Ereda is 40 years old and is married, with three children between 8 and 12 years old. Her business is open from 8am until 6pm every day, including weekends. This is a successful year in her business.  Ereda is the first person on the left side. Ereda and her group have requested the loan in order to purchase more products such as passion fruit, pineapples,apples, and so on. 
Ereda and her group have many plans for the profits that they hope to earn from this loan. They would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children, renovate their houses, as well as purchase more stock for their store.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is a hard working father who owns and manages a tailoring business in his village. He is now 48 years old and has two adult children. Being a responsible father, he wants to raise his family’s standard of living and give them a better life. Despite the hardships and difficulties in his life, he still has a strong determination to reach his goal.

To improve his business, Marcelino is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 so that he can buy fabrics, zippers, thread and needles. Through this loan, he will be able to provide better service and produce more finished products. In the future, he hopes that he can grow his business and make it more viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, thread and needles for his tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one calf and fodder

loans.name: Tet

texts.en:
Mrs. Tet is 62 years old. She is the mother of four lovely children.  Two of them are married and live independently and other two live with her. 

Currently, she generates income as a vegetable planter. She has been running this business  for many years.  From this business activity, she can earn about $2 each day. She is a resident of Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. To upgrade her living, she would like to purchase some farmland but she is lacking funding so she wishes to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva partners. She hopes that all donors will provide this loan to her soon. The loan will provide her support in meeting her financial needs and improving the quality of the product and her agricultural activities. 

Mrs. Tet characterizes herself as an honest woman, honorable and very responsible, prompt with her payments. Her hope in the future is to have a larger house. This is her first loan with Kiva and the second cycle with Kiva's partner.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Sharifabonu

texts.ru: Шарифабону проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Ее родители занимаются бизнесом. Сама Шарифабону занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает метровые шторы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов штор.
texts.en: Sharifabonu lives in the city of Isfara. She is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents. Her parents have a small business. Sharifabonu herself sells curtains at the local market. She has been managing her store for the last four years and would like to take out this loan to purchase more types of curtains for her store.

loans.use: to purchase new types of curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware products

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien was born in 1990. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, in the Duc Tu commune. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in Da Hoi. Hien grows rice and also produces and polishes wood furniture. She works in her workshop, and has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has been involved with SEDA since 2009, and always repays her loans punctually. In this loan cycle she is borrowing 8,066,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mr. Chan is a 44-year-old man who lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. Mr. Chan is works very hard in his farming business to earn a living. Mr. Chan has been married for many years to Mrs. Sai, 45, a domestic farmer. And they have seven children, five of whom are single.  The other children are already married and live separately. Mr. Chan and his wife are able to generate an income about $7.50 USD each day. During this rainy season, this family has difficulties in living because some parts of their shelter are broken. Thus, Mr. Chan would like to request a loan from Kiva to mend his present house. Mr. Chan proposes to use the remainder of the loan to grow a larger rice crop and also to buy a plow. In the future, Mr. Chan hopes he can send his children to school.

loans.use: to mend his present house.

loans.name: Sharifajon

texts.ru: Шарифа женщина предприниматель со стажем, она занимается куплей и продажей более 8 лет. Начала бизнес Шарифа с купли продажи бытовой техники. После того, как работа стала прибыльной, она открыла магазин детской одежды. В магазине Шарифа, кроме детской одежды, продает промтовары. Этим бизнесом она занимается вместе с сестрой. Шарифа вдова имеет дочь, которую выдала замуж. Дочь тоже помогает ей. Шарифе нужны средства для покупки детских колясок  и велосипедов.
texts.en: Sharifajon is a seasoned entrepreneur, she has been working in retail for the last eight years. She started her business by selling appliances, then, as the store became profitable, Sharifajon opened a children clothing store. In her store Sharifajon sells not only clothes but also school supplies and toys. She manages her business together with her sister. Sharifajon is a widow and has a married daughter, who also helps out in the store. Sharifajon would like to take out this loan to buy strollers and children's bikes for the store.

loans.use: to purchase strollers and children's bicycles

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is 40 years old. He is married and has two sons. He sells cattle. As a rule, Mehman purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market.
