Being in this business for 15 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Mehman is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he requests 1300 AZN that he will spend to purchase young cattle and their feed.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
This is Lani, 45, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Aufracio, and is mother to three children. The eldest is already working, while two are still studying in college and elementary school. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lani maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Aside from this she also sells silver jewelries and accessories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lani dreams of expanding her business and having her own house some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mah

texts.fr:
Âgée de 48 ans, Madame Mah est mariée et mère de quatre enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille). Elle vit chez son époux avec ses enfants dans la ville de Sikasso.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité génératrice de revenus qui l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et dispose un kiosque au marché.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ 5 ans. Après 3 prêts individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 5 seaux de pâtes d’arachides, 4 cartons magie, 3 cartons concentrée de tomate,  5 sacs d’oignons et 5 cartons de moutarde à Sikasso. Madame Mah vend  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toute les couches sociales. 
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
At 48, Madame Mah is married and the mother of four children (three boys and one girl). She lives with her husband and their children in the town of Sikasso. 

After having tried several businesses without success, she began, more than 10 years ago, to engage in this money-earning activity selling condiments. She has a great reputation and a stall in the marketplace. 

Wishing to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about five years ago. After three correctly reimbursed individual loans, she is now on her fourth loan which will permit her to grow her working capital so as to buy (in Sikasso) five buckets of peanut butter, four cartons of Maggi cubes, three cartons of tomato paste, five sacks of onions, and five cartons of mustard.  

Madame Mah sells her goods for cash and credit to a clientele composed of all comers. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which she will use to contribute to the family budget, pay the interest on her loan, and invest the remainder back into her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows and fodder

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three school-aged children. Mrs. Kin started a career as a local farmer when she was with her parents. Besides cultivating in the field, she also owns a successful business as a rice supplier. Mrs. Kin can generate an income of approximately $3.50 USD a day. In order to increase her income, Mrs. Kin is seeking a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband to offer a service business to passengers in and around the village. In the future, she wants to decorate her old house and continue supporting her children until they graduate with university degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic articles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy traditional wax fabric.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталия решила воспользоваться кредитом в очередной раз, так как ей нравится удобное оформение и условия кредита(срок, сумма). На полученные Наталья закупит осенний товар. Предыдущий кредит помог Наталье увеличить оборот и получить дополнительную прибыль. Благодаря этому Наталья смогла доделать отопление в своей квартире. Данный вид бизнеса очень нравиться Наталье и она намерена развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Natalya has decided to take out another loan, since she likes the easy application process and the terms of the loan(duration, amount). She is planning to purchase fall inventory with this new loan. Last loan allowed Natalya to increase her turnover and gain additional profit. Thanks to the profit Natalya was able to finish repairs to the heating unit in her apartment. Natalya really likes this type of business and is planning to expand it further.

loans.use: to purchase fall inventory

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a farmer in Nkubu,Central Kenya and is aged 30 years. He has been in farming for 6 years, producing potatoes, maize, and peas, which he sells to the local market. He is married, with no children yet. He runs a cereals retail business in the local market.

Wilfred has requested a loan of 40,000 KES.  This is his first loan request through Juhudi Kilimo. He says he will use the loan to venture into dairy farming by buying dairy goats. He says the dairy goats will be able to survive the harsh weather conditions in the area, especially during dry seasons. He is focusing on establishing a cereals grinding business in future.

He believes that the farming challenge in the area is the result of harsh weather conditions.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 35 years old, married and has for the last four years supported his family of eight by selling soft drinks. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 and is applying for a loan for KES 20,000 to buy 20 bags of soy drinks to sell to his customers. This is his second loan, which he is applying for after having repaid his first loan fully and on time. He dreams of owning a large store someday and earning enough money to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of soy drinks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Yân

texts.en: Mrs. Yan, 50, is a rice cultivator.  She lives with her husband and five lovely children in her own old house, which is located in Prey Chor district, Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. She has been running her rice business since 1995 and works hard every day. She is married to Mr. Theurn who works as a sugar palm-tree climber. From these business activities, they can earn approximately $4 USD each day.  Their house has been becoming old and broken, so they need to make some adjustments. They would like to renovate but they are lacking some capital so they are seeking a loan from HKL and Kiva. They are expecting that lenders will feel pity to their family. This family is very grateful to all kind donors that always help their family.

loans.use: to repair their broken house.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOGNOGONTALA est un groupe constitué de  4 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Tous les quatre prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
AWA, la deuxième à gauche, en boubou noir, fait le commerce d’habillements et de légumes dans ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, une soixantaine  de mètres de bazins. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectue sa vente de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, essentiellement au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Kotognogontala is a group composed of four married women, who are on average 36 years old with four children. They live in polygamous families in the town of Sikasso.
To better satisfy customer demand, they are on their fifth loan with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso. All four previous loans have been repaid punctually.
In this group of women, Kotognogontala, Awa retails clothing and vegetables; she is the second woman from the left, wearing a black caftan.
With her loan, she is planning on purchasing about sixty meters of damask. She gets her supplies from the great market in the town of Sikasso and sells door-to-door in various districts of the town of Sikasso, on orders and within families. Her clientele is composed of men and women, and mostly pays her cash.
She is counting on an average monthly benefit of 37,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan with interests, with the remainder being destined for her savings.

loans.use: to buy damask (fabric).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more poultry to increase profit

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria earns a living by cooking and selling snacks and meals in her village. She has three children, and is eager to increase her income in order to satisfy her family's needs and save for future emergencies. Despite the problems and difficulties she has encountered in life, she is determined to work with her husband to improve her family's status.

She would like to offer new recipes to her customers but first needs to buy ingredients. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and seasonings to cook and sell in her food stall. She believes that this loan will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs, increase her income and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to cook and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 26 years old, married with one child. Her primary business is farming. She has been in the business for the past five years.


She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET client.This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend to buy fertilizer, wheat and maize seeds.

She hopes to use the profit to build a permanent house and buy a good car. Her dream is to create a good environment for the family thus a better standard of living. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a 32-year-old farmer who is married to Agusti, a 29-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children, namely: Julfan, 7, is attending the first grade of elementary school; Yuyun, 5, is attending kindergarten and Radit, 4. Kevin was born into a farming family. He is known as a hard worker. He cultivates corn and kangkung (water spinach), as well as [having a] paddy at the farm. According to Kevin, the income generated from the harvest is unstable due to weather changes. Kevin was thinking of cultivating various vegetables on his farm, such as tomatoes, onions, mustard greens and spinach. Recently he got information from his neighbor about the Individual Lending Program provided by TLM for small farmers like him. He got interested in joining the program and applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. He would like to buy seeds, manure, and pesticides to protect the plants from disease. He is hoping that TLM will approve his application soon.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure and pesticides

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buta, leader du groupe d’affaire «Tupatane », est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 28  ans, mariée, mère de 4 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un enseignant dans une école normale. Elle est  vendeuse de farine de maniocs. Elle installe ses marchandises au petit marché sectoriel de Ndosho-CAJED. Il y a 2 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  2 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut constitué par  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  1 sac de farine de maniocs  à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Buta is the leader of the "Tupatane" business group. She is a young entrepreneur of 28 years, married and the mother of 4 young children. Her husband teaches at a teachers' training college and she sells manioc flour. She has been a trader for 2 years and sells her wares at the regional market of Ndosho-CAJED. Buta got her initial start-up capital from IMF Hekima and has successfully completed 2 loan cycles with the institution. She will use this latest loan to buy a sac of manioc flour for resale. Buta would like to see her children grow up comfortably and expand her business. She would like to thank Hekima for helping underprivileged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy one bag of manioc flour for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mr. Sam, 36 years old, is a villager in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. He is married with three children. All of his children are single and school-age. Mr. Sam has worked as a local cultivator as well as a mortar maker for many years. From mortar making, he typically earns $4.50 USD per day. His wife also assists him in the same occupation. The heavy rainfall is a good sign for him to grow rice crops. Because of lacking financial sources, Mr. Sam is looking for a loan to support his crop-planting business.  He will use it to purchase insecticides and to hire local laborers to help him during the  harvest process. Mr. Sam said that in the future, he’ll be able to enlarge his mortar-making business to satisfy his customers’ needs and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and to hire local laborers to help him in harvest process.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah has been selling clothes and shoes for the last five years. She is separated and has two children, ages 7 and 14 years old. Virginiah has lived in Malindi town for the last 15 years. Malindi is a tourist destination town. The challenge Virginiah faces is when the town is in low season and she receives low sales and more competition from other sellers.

Virginiah has been a Milango client since June 2011. She heard about Milango from her friends and joined a self-help group. A loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings will help Virginiah restock her business with shoes and clothes so she can have enough sales to prepare some savings for her child who is entering high school next year. She will also be able to get a larger variety of items to sell. She plans to repay her loan and obtain a larger loan in order to open other centers where she can sell clothes and also employ other staff.

loans.use: to buy new stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer, planting corn in the Philippines. The couple is doing their best to raise their standard of living. 
With a determination to earn income sufficient to sustain their daily household expenses, Fely is involved in a retail business which is a sari-sari (variety) store. While waiting for her customers to buy her products, Fely also runs a hog-raising business.
Now, Fely is happy that she already has six pigs to raise. She is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy feed and vaccines of her pigs so that they can grow faster.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines of her pigs so that they can grow faster.

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 64 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Кудратулло уже четыре года как занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Kudratullo lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 64 years old, married and has three children. Kudratullo has been raising livestock for the last four years. He purchases calves and raises them for further sale. He would like to take out this loan to purchase another calf.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a farmer who lives in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya, where he has worked for the last five years producing milk, peas, maize and beans to sell in the local market. He is 28 years old, single and also sells used clothing. He is applying for a loan for KES 63,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this cow will increase his income and enable him to expand his business and better care for his family. His goal is to eventually own five cows and buy a motorcycle to help transport supplies to the market. His main problem is the high price of farm supplies such as fertilizer, but he greatly appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services to farmers.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Urias

texts.en:
Urias is a 48-year-old man married to Damaris, 46 years old. They are blessed with four children, namely: John, 25, and Jenny, 24 (both studying at university); Marleni, 21 (graduated from senior high school); and Sipriadi, 13 (studying in the first grade of junior high school).

Urias owns a broiler business. This business has been running for 10 years using his own capital. His wife, Damaris, and the children assist him in feeding, providing water and cleaning up the stalls. Urias never faces difficulty running the business, as customers always come to buy the chickens at his house directly. 

Urias desires to improve his business by raising more chicks. Limited capital leads him to seek a loan from TLM. He wants to buy chicks to raise and fodder as well. He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. He is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to be raised and fodder

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married with no children.  She has been working in the textile industry for nine years.  She was working for someone else when she decided to open her own workshop at the same time.  She started with two machines.  With support from people around her, she now has four machines.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she wants to buy a more advanced sewing machine so that she could improve the quality of her work and increase her production. She hopes to keep expanding her workshop so that she can give other housewives employment opportunities.  She is a hard-working, productive, and disciplined woman.  She loves her work and can only think about trying to grow her business.




Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ayşe Hanım evli ve çocuğu yok.  Ayşe Hanım,dokuz yıldır tekstil atölyesinde çalışıyor.  Tekstil atölyesinde çalışırken ek iş olarak atölye açmaya karar verdi.  İki makina ile işe başladı.  Çevresinden destekle şu anda dört makinası var.  Bu kredi ile daha gelişmiş bir makina almak istiyor.  Yeni makinayla daha düzgün ve daha fazla üretim yapabileceğini düşünüyor.  Gelecekteki hayallerinde daha büyük bir atölye ve daha fazla ev hanımına iş imkanı verebilmek var.  Ayşe Hanım,çalışkan,üretken ve disiplinli bir kadın.İşini seviyor ve önce işini büyütmeyi düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy a more advanced sewing machine

loans.name: Ekiru

texts.en: Ekiru is 24 years old, married, has one child and earns a living by running a kiosk where he buys and sells fish. He has been in business for five years and earns KES 16,900. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after paying his first one fully and on time. He will use the new loan to buy more fish to sell to his customers. With the profits he expects to earn, he will buy fishing nets. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to expand his business of buying and selling fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional inventory of sandals and slippers for her business

loans.name: Jerome

texts.fr:
Jerome est né au Rwanda et il a 29 ans. Il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire. 

Jerome est transporteur (il a un taxi moto). C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter un taxi vélo moteur pour le transport. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de travailler beaucoup plus, jusqu'à ce qu’il peut même acheter de la moto.
Dans les prochaines années, Jerome voudrait finaliser les études universitaires. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’aider sa famille de se développer. Jerome est aussi salarie.
texts.en:
Jerome was born in Rwanda and is 29 years old. He is single. He attended secondary school for 6 years. 

Jerome provides transport services (he has a motorcycle taxi). This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle taxi for transportation.

He intends to grow his business by working much harder, until he is able to buy more motorcycles.
In the coming years, Jerome would like to complete his university studies. He will use his profits to help his family grow. Jerome also has a fixed salary.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle taxi for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to his savings and buy another pick-up for his transport business.

loans.name: 03.13.84 Thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng works in retail. She is requesting a loan to purchase waste materials to resell to factories that can recycle them. Hồng is 38 years old and married with two dependent children. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. Hồng has been involved in her business for six years. The main hardships that Hồng faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

This is Hồng's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hồng hopes for her business to do well so she can make enough money to provide for her kids and to remodel her house. 

Mrs. Hồng is the leader of the 03.13.84 Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of five members.

loans.use: to purchase waste materials to resell

loans.name: Sirote

texts.en:
Sirote is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 26 years old, married, with one child. 


She has been a good client and is applying for her second loan. She plans to use a part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and the other to use in her business.

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, both college students, in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Hovd Province of Mongolia. Narantsetseg started her business in 1999 by making home utilities out of steel at her home and selling them at the local market. Her husband and children support and manage the enterprise together. 

Their family expenses are going up due to their children's college tuition fees. A hard-working and diligent woman, Narantsetseg says, "I am going to buy a car for my children so that they can earn money with it as a taxi during the weekends. Perhaps income from the taxi service will help us to cover many expenses." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy a new car and provide taxi service to the local town.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio, who grows corn in the Philippines, is 63 years old, married, and the father of five adult-aged children. A farmer for 43 years, Elpidio also runs a hog- raising business which provides an additional source of income for the family.

He is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for the pigs he raises and believes that the loan will be a big help in maintaining his business. In the future, Elpidio wants to expand his business and save for his and his wife's future, as they are both growing older.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs he raises.

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 32 is a skillful hairdresser and has been doing this job for 8 years. He lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, located in the slum district of  Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He will become a father soon and will be responsible for his family. 
He plans to expand his business by opening new locations around the districts of Ulaanbaatar. 
Last April, Enkhbaatar bought a small-sized plot of land near his barbershop which is necessary for his job and family. Then, he started building a branch of his barber shop as well as his own house. Unfortunately, the project suddenly stopped due to lack of money for building materials. Opening the new branch of his barber shop is very important to expanding in the market and his business future. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to open the new location for his barber shop business.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials to build a new location for his barber shop business.

loans.name: C9240Twunganirane Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 31 years old and is single. She is the leader of this group, called "Twunganirane," which is commonly known for selling sugar, Irish potatoes, salt, rice, tomatoes, and so forth. Agnes and her team have been in this business for about one year; their business hours are from 6 am until 8 pm every day. Agnes is the middle person in the photo of the group.

Agnes and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. The team will use the loan to expand their business by purchasing different goods such as Irish potatoes, salt, rice, and tomatoes to sell. If successful, Agnes and her team hope to earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition, they will continue to improve their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, Irish potatoes, salt, rice, tomatoes, and so forth.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.en:
Jacoba is a 48-year-old lady who is married to Nikson, a 68-year-old man. They have nine children, namely: Adrianus, 23, attending university; Maria, 19, graduated from senior high school; Carlos, 15, and Yani, 13, both studying at junior high school; Michele, 11, and Siwan, 10, both studying at primary school; Fitri, 9, studying in third grade of primary school; Jemris, 7, and Nova, 4, both not at school yet.

Jacoba works as a junk collector. She is assisted by her husband in collecting trash – such as copper, brass and plastic bottles – from the garbage dumps to be sold to her regular customers. From this business, Jacoba and her husband can generate enough income for their daily living. 

In order to improve her business, Jacoba is seeking a loan of 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She wants to spend the loan on scrap metal and used plastic bottles in bulk from other junk collectors to be resold. She hopes that TLM will approve her application to support her in improving the business.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and used plastic bottles in bulk

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Ramadhan, who is in his early 40s, is married with two children who are still in school. He has been running a fruit business for 20 years now. He works from 6 a.m to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his stock of fruit, pay school fees, and pay household expenses. He paid back the loan successfully and has requested a new loan to buy more fruit to sell.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Muheza," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Dilrabohon's Group

texts.en:
Dilrabohon is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married to a builder whose monthly salary is 6000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). She and her husband are raising two daughters and two sons; all the children are studying in school.

In 2001, Dilrabohon’s husband saved 6000 soms and purchased some livestock. Later they resold the livestock and earned some profit. Since then, Dilrabohon has been engaged in breeding livestock. This activity made it possible for them to repair their house. With the money received from her loan, Dilrabohon will purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening, and resale. In the future, she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a farmer who plants corn in the Philippines. Determined to avoid financial shortfalls for his family, he has decided to restart his hog-raising business. He had to stop the business temporarily, a year ago, because he lacked the financial means to feed his pigs.

George is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed and piglets. He will also use the loan to buy galvanized iron sheeting to roof his piggery house. He will repair the roof to provide comfortable housing for his pigs.

George will use the loan wisely to continue his hog-raising business. His profit goes to pay his two children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар любит  печь. Она с мужем занимается приготовлением хлебобулочных изделий. Дома у них тандыр (национальная печь) в котором  муж Мунаввар печет хлеб (лепешки), а она продает их на местном базаре. Она  с мужем занимается этим бизнесом  более 10 лет. Мунаввар имеет 3 детей. Старший сын помогает родителям. Семья Мунаввар дружная и поэтому  у них налаженный и прибыльный бизнес. Они хотят получить кредит для покупки муки и угля, тем самым  расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Munavvar loves to bake. Together with her husband she has a home bakery. At home they have a tandoori oven in which Munavvar's husband bakes the traditional Kyrgyz flatbreads which Munavvar sells at the local market. Together they have been running the bakery for the last 10 years. Munavvar has three children. The eldest son helps his parents with baking. Munavvar's family work well with each other and because of it the business runs smoothly and is profitable. They want to take out this loan to purchase a big batch of flour and coal wholesale, so that they can expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester, a 42-year-old farmer, is married to Daniel, a 51-year-old man. They have two children, namely: Pace, 20, and Danes, 18. Ester is living with her husband and her son in a modest house. In order to help her husband cover their daily needs, Ester uses a plot of land to cultivate spinach, kangkung (water spinach) and onions. Ester enjoys her days as a farmer – watering, fertilizing and spraying pesticides as well. Ester is thinking of trying another business raising pigs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She wants to spend the loan on two piglets and fodder. She is really hoping that TLM is willing to assist her in implementing this plan.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and fodder

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фаррух умелый рыболов. Вот уже 20 лет занимается куплей и продажей рыбы. Он женат, имеет 3-х  несовершеннолетних детей. С каждым годом растет спрос в употреблении рыбы, Фаррух  хочет  получить кредит для покупки товара и увеличение оборотного капитала.  Он заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Farrukh is a skilled fisherman and has been selling fish for the last 20 years. He is married and has 3 young children. Every year demand for fish increases and Farrukh wants to take out a loan to purchase more fish for his market stall and so increase his profits. He would like to thank his lenders in advance for their kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase goods and increase store's capital

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул предприниматель. В этом бизнесе он уже 17 лет. Абдурасул занимается куплей и продажей рыбы. У него жена и  4 детей. Дети у него несовершеннолетние, поэтому  в бизнесе отца не участвуют. Зная, что спрос к рыбе не уменьшается, а возрастет, Абдурасул хотел бы получить кредит  для покупки товара и  увеличения  оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Abdurasul is an entrepreneur and has been running his fish selling business for the last 17 years. He has a wife and four children, who are too young to help Abdurasul in his business. Since demand for fish has been steadily increasing, Abdurasul would like to take out this loan to purchase more fish wholesale and increase his business's working capital.

loans.use: to purchase goods and increase the store's working capital

loans.name: Djumal

texts.ru: Джумал проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Джумал уже 20 лет как занимается торговлей. Она у себя дома продает ткани. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Djumal lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 55 years old, married and has two children. She has high school education. Djumal has been working in retail for the last 20 years. She sells fabrics from home. She is taking out this loan to purchase new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a 31-year-old man who is married and has three sons and two daughters. He lives in Biet Lahia, which is located in the Gaza Strip, in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.

Mosa wants to replace his old home furniture with new furniture such as beds for his children and seating for the living room in order to provide better living conditions for his family. He does not have enough money to pay for the furniture, so he needs to take out a loan from FATEN. When he gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the new furniture. Mosa was photographed at the FATEN branch.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see requested includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор занимается  откормом крупного рогатого скота и овца. Муж Гулбахор в России на заработке, у нее один ребенок. В приусадебном участке  она выращивает сельскохозяйственных культур. Молочную продукцию, производимую от скота, она продает на местном рынке. В этом  ей помогает сын. Вместе с сыном Гулбахор  решила запастись кормом и купить еще скот, и для этого они хотят  получить кредит.
texts.en: Gulbahor raises sheep and cattle for a living. Her husband is working in Russia and they have one child together. On her home plot she grows fruits and vegetables and she sells dairy products from her cows at the local market. Her son helps her taking care of the animals. Together with him Gulbahor has decided to stock up on feed and purchase more cattle and they would like to take out a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones is a 42-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail shop business for eight years. He acquired the initial capital from the savings of his salary as a teacher. His hardship is high commodity prices leading to low profits and his vision is to own a wholesale business, to have financial independence,  and to educate his children. Jones needs the loan facility to buy sugar and bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar and bread for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a 39-year-old married man with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for seven years. He started with 800,000 shillings and now has 4,500,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is lack of sufficient capital to meet the different tastes of his customers and his dream is to own a boutique in town and to educate his children. Gideon needs the loan facility to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory of mats and brooms for sale

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is a 47-year-old married man with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling milk for twelve years. With the income earned, he bought a milk cooler so as to preserve the milk. His hardship is the dry season which leads to low production. His vision is to buy Friesian cows (a breed of cattle known today as the world's highest production dairy animal) so as to increase production and educate his children. Mario needs the loan to buy cows for milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows for milk production.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed is a 29-year-old young man. He is married and has two sons. He owns a barber shop which is the only source of income for the family. Waheed wants to expand his shop and make some repairs and improvements on the inside. Also, he wants to purchase a new barber kit including items such as a shaving kit, hair products, etc. but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for it, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Waheed takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase a new barber kit and make the necessary repairs in his shop. This will impact his work positively and he will work extra to get a better income in order to live in better conditions with his family. Waheed is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new barber kit and to make some repairs to his shop.

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru: Абдугаффор водитель со стажем. Он более 26 лет ведет деятельность в сфере транспортного обслуживания. Его машина в хорошем состоянии. В день в среднем 4-5 раз он возит пассажиров с одного направления на другое. Абдугаффор  ведет эту предпринимательскую деятельность (так как это частный транспорт) по маршруту местных районах. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки шины и запчастей для своего автомобиля. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdugaffor is a seasoned driver with 26 years of experience. His vehicle is in excellent condition. Every day he drives approximately 4-5 times between the two final destinations of his route. Abdugaffor's transportation business covers several key destinations in the region. He would like to take out a loan to purchase tires and spare parts for his vehicle. He would like to thank all of his lenders in advance.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rocks for her business

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 34, married with one child under the age of 2. He has been in farming for over 6 years producing beans, tomatoes, and watermelons. He relies fully on farming for his family livelihood.

Timothy has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhugi Kilimo to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes in order to boost his farming income. He is optimistic that the business will continue to grow and reach external markets. He says that the improved farming business will enable him to meet family needs.

He adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans are turning around farmers' lives.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a 34-year-old divorced woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 16 years, having acquired capital from her previous employment as a housemaid. Her hardship is lack of enough capital to buy different forms of synthetic hair. Her vision is to open up another salon and to educate her children. Norah needs this loan to buy hair weaves for the salon.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves for the salon

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en: Hadijja is a 48-year-old widow with two children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for ten years. She started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is limited funds to meet the tastes of clients and her vision is to own a big textile-and-garments shop plus a financially stable family. Hadijja intends to use the credit to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rocks for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 46-year-old widow with eight children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for two years, starting with capital from her late husband's salary benefits of 500,000 shillings. Now she has 2,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardships are price fluctuations and theft during transportation of her goods. Her vision is to own a wholesale business and to educate her children.

Mary needs this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 26 years old, married to Jacqueline, and together they have one child. He is a scrap-metal dealer in Mathare North. Most of his customers are low-income earners. He has been in the business for the past six years. He receives a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the amount to buy more scrap metal to stock his business. Anticipated profits will be used to expand his business and improve his living standard. He hopes to own a hardware store and to be financially stable. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of scrap metal for the business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 49 years old and married to Dorothy. Together they have three children. James has been operating a general store for the last four years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to move into a spacious shop and add more stock of flour, cooking fat, salt, rice, sugar, and bar soap to the business.

In the future, he wants to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to move into a spacious shop and add more stock of flour, cooking fat, salt, rice, sugar, and bar soap.

loans.name: Sabren

texts.en:
Sabren is a 28-year-old single woman from Al Hashmi, Amman.

Sabren is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase a new sewing machine to be added to her old ones so that she can meet the increased demand.

Sabren is looking to open her own shop and purchase a house.

The woman in the picture is Sabren's sister.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his commercial house.

loans.name: Mаhpora

texts.ru: Махпора женщина предприниматель. Она занимается куплей и продажей обуви, одежды, разных материалов. Также она покупает и продает парфюмерию и другие промышленные товары. Махпора ведет бизнес совместно с супругом, который помогает ей во всем.  Она два раза в месяц едет в базар за покупкой нового товара. Она старается  обновлять  ассортимент товаров, чтобы привлечь  как можно больше покупателей-клиентов.
texts.en: Mahpora is female entrepreneur. She resells shoes, clothes and fabrics at her store. She also sells perfume and other goods. Mahpora runs her business together with her husband who helps her in the store. Twice a months she travels to a wholesale market to purchase more goods for her store. She tries her best to keep her inventory new and current so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to expand inventory and purchase winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rock for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25 years old single man from A.-Hashmi-Amman.

Ali has his own restaurant and is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian dinars (JOD) to expand the business and purchase new equipment.

Ali is looking to opening a new branch of his restaurant and purchase his own house.

loans.use: to expand his restaurant and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Мухаббат занимается торговлей у себя дома. Она продает детскую одежду и ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 21 год. Кредит берет для покупки женской и мужской одежды, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Muhabbat lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 42 years old, married and has four children.  Muhabbat is involved in sales at home.  She sells children's clothing and fabrics.  She has been in this business for 21 years.  Muhabbat is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's and men's clothing in order to expand her merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Alice D.

texts.en: Alice is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has an eight-year-old child that is presently in school and lives at home. For the past  twenty years she has been operating a charging shop for electronic appliances. She like the ways people respond to her business and how it makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock and wire for her business. She plans to build a house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and wire for her business.

loans.name: Vimbai Group

texts.en:
Phinias is 48 years old and lives in Gweru. He is married and has two children aged ten months and seven years. 

Phinias is a general dealer and has two employees. He has been in the business for seven years. He sells groceries and chicken cuts in Zvishavane. The challenges he faces include a lack of funds and transport challenges. 

With the loan of $400 USD, he wishes to buy soap, cooking oil and sugar for his shop. The additional income will enable him to buy a house in Zvishavane.

In the future, Phinias plans to run a bigger supermarket.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA. is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. NawA. is from Sahab, Amman, Jordan.

NawA. has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian dinars (JOD) to make new decorations for her store.

One of NawA.'s aspirations is to increase her family's income and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to decorate her store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old. He is married with two children. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.


He learned about KADET  LTD  from registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for tomato planting. Tomatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standards and education of his children. His dream is to prosper in the business of tomato farming. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for tomato planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional hairdressing tools and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh meat for her business.

loans.name: Sadiye

texts.en:
Sadiye is 55 years old and married. She has four children. The youngest child is 23 and the oldest one is 35 years old.

"Before I started the trading business, I was a housewife. I raised four kids, but while I was struggling against financial problems, I could buy and sell a very little amount  of goods. Later I decided to open my own shop. Taking the support of my husband and my oldest son, I  opened my own shop. However, I have been through very hard times, and unfortunately I had to close my shop when I could not afford the rent. Back at home, I finished the remaining products by selling them to relatives, and I somehow managed to pay my debts." 

"Just when I thought I was desperate, I discovered Maya. With the loans I borrowed from Maya, I bought new products from a wholesaler and I am back in business in my house. With the loans I borrowed from Maya, I can buy more products with a cheaper total price. My plans for the future are, if my affairs continue to go as fast and as well as they are going now, to open a shop--not in the city center but in a closer spot to my house--and to support my children and grandchildren as much as I can (by means of both financial and psychological support). My family is really important to me. I love my children and grandchildren so much."

This person’s distinctive characteristics: an ambitious and unyielding woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff


Sadiye Hanım 55 yaşında ve evli.Dört çocuğu var.En küçüğü 23 ve en büyüğü 35 yaşında.Ticarete başlamadan önce ev hanımıydım 4 çocuk büyütmüştüm ama maddi sıkıntılar içinde zorlanırken az az mal alıp  evde satıyordum.Daha sonra dükkan açmaya karar verdim başlarken eşimin ve büyük oğlumun desteğini alarak dükkan açtım. Fakat çok zor dönmenlerden geçtim kiramı,vergimi ödeyemez hale gelince dükkanımı kapatmak zorunda kaldım. Elimde kalan mallarımı ise evde çevreme satarak bitirdim ve borçlarımı bu şekilde ödedim.Tam ümidimi yitirdim derken Maya ile tanıştım.Maya'dan aldığım kredi ile tekrar toptancılardan mal aldım ve evimde ticaret yapıyorum.Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi ile daha çok mal alabiliyorum ve daha ucuza alabiliyorum.Gelecek için planlarım ise eğer işlerim böyle hızlı ve güzel giderse bu sefer çarşı merkezde değil, evime daha yakın biryerlerde dükkan açmak ve çocuklarıma torunlarıma maddi anlamda elimden geldiği kadar yardımcı olabilmek.Ailem benim için çok önemlidir. Çocuklarımı ve torunlarımı çok seviyorum.Hırslı ve yılmayan bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy new products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 crates of soft drinks, beer, and stout, and to buy 15 pairs of dishes for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 51-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. In 2005, he started selling a wide range of Lebanese food products such as bread in order to support his family. And today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products to sell. He will also perform the needed maintenance on his car to facilitate products delivery throughout towns and villages. This will be his second Kiva loan. It’s positive to learn that he has indeed increased his sales and income since taking the first loan. In the future, Ahmad plans to open his own grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and perform needed maintenance on his car to facilitate product delivery.

loans.name: Gormah

texts.en: Gormah is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is divorced and has seven children between 5 and 18 years old, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, onion, and soda in the local market. She makes less profit because she has less goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, and soda for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, and soda for her business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 35-year-old engaged man from Lebanon, living on his own. He has six years of experience working as a farmer. In 2007, he bought a plot of land where he started to cultivate vegetables. His products are all sold to multiple agricultural markets that he deals with and he has one part-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to repair his car as he uses it to transport vegetables to the markets. In the future, he plans to open a vegetable shop.

loans.use: to repair his car as he uses it to transport vegetables to the markets.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. Five years ago, he decided to start running his own business. So he got involved in the construction field in order to earn good income to help his parents pay the heavy life expenses. His job is specialized in brick positioning. Today, he is applying for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy construction tools and supplies. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you Fatmata, a small scale entrepreneur from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. A native of Makali village, near Magburaka, Fatmata is 47 year old. She is married to a health worker and the couple has 7 children – 2 in primary school and 5 in secondary school. Fatmata sells plastic bowls, dishes, cloths, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Fatmata has requested this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, dishes, cloths, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a farmer for over 10 years. In 2004, he decided to proceed with his business operation alone in his own farm. And today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase farming equipment. Hasan is very optimistic and estimates that with the coming harvesting, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his son’s university education fees.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
22 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción se unieron con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con lo cual podrán ayudar a sus hijos y demás familiares. Ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, denominaron al comité con el nombre de Virgen de Fátima, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, trabajador y muy solidario las unas con las otras.
La señora Elvira es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella logra obtener los medios necesarios para mantener a su familia. Dice que tiene mucha demanda, en especial los fines de semana donde siempre tiene el doble de ventas.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de bebidas, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
22 women from the city of Asunción joined together to improve their living conditions so that they can help their children and other relatives.  They are friends and neighbors from this city.  They gave the committee the name "Virgen de Fátima", and currently they are in their fourth lending cycle.  We can tell you that the group is very responsible, hard-working and very united.

Señora Elvira is one of the members, she works selling all kinds of drinks.  She comments that thanks to this work, she has been able to earn the money necessary to support her family.  She says that she has a lot of demand for her products, especially on weekends when her sales always double.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of drinks such as beer, soda, wine and other things, with which she can stock up and meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, wine and other drinks.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Grace is a 24 years old and married with two children. She operates a quarry business. She has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD ,she repaid her previous loans successfully and on time. She intends to use the entire loan amount to purchase necessary farm inputs for her farm. 

She will also use some of the amount to buy pesticides and also put aside the rest of the amount to pay the laborers in the farm.

loans.use: To purchase an extra quarrying site.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 56-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has 25 years of experience working in selling fish. In 1990, since he works on a freelance basis, he bought a trolley to use for fish carrying. In order to develop his work and facilitate his business operation, Ali is applying today for a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a minivan. He states that the van will help him expand his business into other areas where his fish sales will be increased. He feels positive about his business prospects and is willing to open a fish store within the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон проживает в районе Шахринав. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Фарходчон имеет среднее образование. Он два года как занимается производством кирпичей. Кредит берет для покупки оптом песка. Фарходчон хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Farhodjon lives in the Shahrinav district.  He is 33 years old, married and has four children.  Farhodjon has a secondary education.  He has been involved in brick-making for two years.  He is requesting this loan for the whole purchase of sand.  Farhodjon wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand wholesale

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Fidel es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, es dueño de un taller de reparaciones de Motocicletas, trabajo de tornerías, reparaciones en general y su señora es costurera. Tienen tres hijos, uno de ellos posee trabajo seguro, los dos son menores y están en edad escolar. El señor tiene casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familiar, posee móvil de transporte propio que es una motocicleta.
Comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace 25 años, por lo que ya tiene una vasta experiencia en lo que hace. Además de eso gracias a todo este tiempo ha podido formarse ya una clientela que frecuentemente acude hasta él.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para las reparaciones que realiza, pues de esa forma puede cumplir mejor con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Fidel is married and lives in the city of Pilar.  He is the head of a motorcycle repair workshop.  He works with lathes and does repairs in general, and his wife is a seamstress.  They have three children, one of whom has a secure job.  The other two are younger and still school-age.  The Señor owns his own home, with amenities for his family's well-being.  He has is own mode of transport, which is a motorcycle.

He comments that he has been doing this work for 25 years, and so has vast experience in what he does.  Additionally, he is grateful that during this time he has gained a customer base who frequently come to him.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of spare parts for the repairs he does, as in this way he will be better able to service his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some telecom products (mobile phones and accessories) so that he can change his business activities and make greater profits.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been running a clothing store for the past 21 years. He sells women's and children's clothes. He is the only income source of the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his store’s inventory with a new winter clothes collection. He is certain that the loan will help him get a diversity of new original clothes. In the future, he plans to branch out his business and start selling men's clothes.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory with a new winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Fabacary Demba Diang

texts.fr:
Fabacary habite dans region au sud du senegal.Il est un célibataire sans enfant depuis 6 ans il est dans le commerce de detail .Donc il a demande ce credit augment la quantite des marchandises dans sa boutique : les accessoires,les portables,chargeurs, les cartes memoires etc 
Avec ce credit il veut construir sa vie avant de se marie,en soutenant sa famille renforcer son activite et avoir sa propre maison pour mieux vivre avec ces enfants.
texts.en: Fabacary lives in southern Senegal. He is single, has no children and has been working in retail for 6 years. He will use this loan to increase his stock of merchandise including mobile phones, accessories, chargers and memory cards. He would like to build a good life before getting married, by supporting his family, strengthening his business and getting his own house in which to raise his future children.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, accessories, memory cards, etc.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is aged 41 and married with three children, one of whom is still schooling. She is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya, where she has been doing mixed farming for 20 years. Her farm currently employs three farmhands and produces tea, milk and maize, all of which go to the local market.

Jenefer has made a loan request amounting to 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional dairy cow. She had previously acquired two loans of 50,000 KES, which were paid promptly. She says her improved income due to the additional dairy cow will enable her to adequately provide the family with their basic needs.

She mentions unreliable artificial insemination services and markets as the major challenges for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and two young children, who are still attending school. Despite his old age, he is still working in the construction field, as he has since 1980. He is specialized at completing painting work. 

With his requested loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase necessary paints and scaffolding in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase necessary paints and scaffolding.

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. He has built good experience working in floor covering for the past 10 years. And in 2004, he started working independently, taking private projects. This man represents the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a new engine for his car in order to facilitate his transportation to projects where he works. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a new engine for his car in order to facilitate his transportation to projects where he works.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a poultry shop since 2010. His shop is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many poultry shops, and it‘s easy to buy chickens in one’s village or neighborhood. 

During the past year, he was able to build a good business reputation due to the fresh goods that he offers to his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a refrigerator to help him preserve food products. He is very positive and hopes to achieve substantial growth with the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to help him preserve food products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 31 and married with four children aged between 9 and 3 years. She has been in active farming for four years, producing eggs and vegetables for the local market.

Jane has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for her business. She had previously acquired two loans of 25,000 KES and 50,000 KES and paid them promptly. She says the boosted poultry business will enable her to educate her four children.

She praises Juhudu Kilimo for the loan services and is focused on repaying the loan like the previous ones.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his purchases of dairy products to sell

loans.name: Patterson Fostaren

texts.en:
Patterson is a 29 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. He describes himself to be hardworking. 

He operates a carpentry business where he provides timber and furniture. He has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor road networks and seasonality. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase timber for his carpentry business. 

His business goal is to have bought a plot of his own and put up a permanent structure/show room for his furniture within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. 

He has been working as a mechanic for more than 15 years. In 2009, he opened his own car repair shop. His job consists of changing cars oil. Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional mechanical tools and supplies needed. He is sure that with this purchase he will be able to meet his business needs and the requests of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies for his car repair shop

loans.name: Everlynne Flora

texts.en:
Everlynne is a 30 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 9 months and 3 years. She considers herself to be a visionary woman. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking fat, rice, maize flour, bread, soda, and other items. It is located next to a primary school. She has been in this business for 3 years. She describes her biggest business challenges to be poor road networks and difficult transport. 

She will use the loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase maize flour and rice to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will have bought a pick up vehicle for transporting stock and to expand her business to wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and rice to sell at her store

loans.name: Buena Ventura

texts.es:
El Señor Buena tiene 45 años de edad, está casado con la señora Sergia de 51 años, ellos viven en su casa propia, tienen dos hijos. El posee una gomería hace más de cinco años, y su señora se dedica a la artesanía, ya que  fabrica sobrecama que despues es comercializado por  la zona. Buena es muy sacrificado pues su gomería esta a 2 km de su domicilio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra – venta de materia prima para la confección de sobrecamas.
Buena de a poco compro para sus herramientas, primeramente habilitó para su gomería en su domicilio, hasta que se hizo de capital suficiente y trajo neumáticos usados de la capital habilitando en un lugar estrategico de la ciudad en la entrada mismo al costado de un surtidor sobre ruta internacional. Hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de su servicio.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de neumáticos usados con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder cumplir ocn sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Buena is 45 years old.  He is married to Señora Sergia, aged 51.  They live in their own home and have two children.

He has had a tire shop for more than five years, and his wife works in handicrafts making bedspreads that she then sells in the areas.  Buena is a very self-sacrificing man, and his tire shop is 2 km from him home.  Previously he worked buying and selling materials for making bedspreads.

At first, Buena just bought tools and initially ran his tire shop from home until he had sufficient capital.  He then brought used tires from the capital and set up in strategic premises next to a gas station on a main international highway entering the city.  Today he has an established customer base founded on his good service and the good quality of his work.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of used tires with which he can stock up, and so meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy used tires for his workshop.

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati is 50 years-old. She is married and has 3 children aged 25, 21 and 18. 

In 2000, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys food materials for her business. 

In the future, Sarswati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve living standards extra trainings are needed. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Mahfotha

texts.en:
Mahfotha is a 54 year old hardworking mother. She decided to work with her husband in making and selling a specific type of candy which is called “A. Anbar candy”; it is basically made of apples dipped in colored sweet dip.

Mahfotha makes the candy and her husband sells it on a motor bike around their neighborhood. They have applied for a loan in order to buy a small distributing bus.

loans.use: To buy a small distributing bus to sell candy.

loans.name: Yamen

texts.en:
Yamen is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children. 

In 2009, he opened a small shop in his town where he sells a wide range of mobile phones. With his loan request of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones to sell. He reports that both his business sales and income will be increased as a result of the loan. 

In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Berthilde

texts.en:
Berthilde is 42 years old, and is married with six children between the ages 1 and 17 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well known for selling various goods such as: milk, biscuits, water, soap, sugar, juice etc. Her business hours are from 7am until 8pm every day except on Saturday, and she currently employs two people to help her.

Berthilde has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more new goods such as: lotions, biscuits, soap, cooking oil etc for sale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future. Berthilde hopes also to pay school fees for her children and that she will be able to buy a cow with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as lotions, biscuits, soap and cooking oil to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is 35 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 6.  

In 2005, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.  

In the future, Lalita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve living standards extra training is needed. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. 

In 2008, he opened a small shop where he started repairing motorcycles and repainting them. Today, he is applying for a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical tools instead of used ones. He intends to reinforce his business operation and strengthen it. 

In the future, he plans to start repairing cars. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man.  He is living with his parents and two siblings.  He works on a freelance basis selling sweets and candies to many groceries stores and to individuals located in different areas and villages.  Ahmad has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client by making payments on time.  He requested to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to purchase additional merchandise to sell.  In the future, he hopes to open his own sweets and candies shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon.  He is living with one parent and three siblings.  He has owned a curtain store in his town since 2009.  He gained advantages from his first Kiva loan and was very satisfied with the results.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase drapes of different shapes, designs, and sizes.  In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase drapes from different shapes, designs and sizes.

loans.name: Maria Urbana

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 43 años, está casada con el Señor Alberto D. 45 años, el señor es empleado en una empresa privada tienen 4 hijas, una D. las cuales se encuentra en España trabajando, la otra está en la facultad estudiando Licenciatura en Obstetricia, y las demás están en el colegio y escuela respectivamente.
La señora Maria tiene un local D. ventas D. comestibles y bebidas, anteriormente era empleada domestica, vendió una propiedad que poseía para poder abrir su negocio que actualmente cuenta con una importante cantidad D. clientes, ya que esta ubicado en el centro del mercado D. Luque. Le gustaría  abrir una ferretería algún día ya que es su sueño D. siempre, por eso su hija viajo al exterior para poder conseguir mas capital ya que en nuestro medio no conseguía trabajo.
