Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. huevo, pan, discos para empanadas, carne, mayonesa y otros, los cuales son esenciales para la elaboración D. sus alimentos.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and married to Alberto, 45. Alberto is has a job with a private company. They have four daughters, one of whom is working in Spain, another is studying for a degree in obstetrics, and the other two are still in secondary and elementary school.
María has a stall where she sells food and drinks. She used to be a maid and sold a property she owned to be able to open a business. She currently has a good client base, since she's located right in the middle of the Luque market. She'd like to open a hardware store one day, which has always been her dream. That's why her daughter traveled abroad to earn more money, since she couldn't find a job locally.
María is requesting a loan to buy eggs, bread, discs for making empanadas, meat, mayonnaise, and other ingredients that are essential to preparing her foods.

loans.use: to buy eggs, bread, discs for making empanadas, meat, mayonnaise, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Pancha Laxmi

texts.en:
Pancha Laxmi is 42 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 26, 22, and 21.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Pancha Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Cristina es casada, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales estudia, se dedica a la tejeduría de blusas típicas y la costura de las mismas, inició este trabajo como empleada y hasta el momento lleva  5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para compra hilos de diferente clases y colores, para el tejido y costura de mas güipíles, espera en el futuro contar con operarios.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Cristina is married, 29 years of age, and completed her elementary school education.  She has two children, 1 of which is in school.  

Rosa Cristina is a weaver and a seamstress of traditional blouses.  She started working as an employee but now has five years of experience.  Rosa Cristina has the support of her husband, who is also a weaver.  

She is requesting a loan to buy yarn of different types and colors for weaving and stitching more blouses.  In the future, she plans to hire workers.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Vita

texts.ru:
Вите нужен кредит для закупки осеннего товара. Она хочет приобрести женские колготки и теплые мужские рубашки.
За счет предыдущего кредита Вита расширила ассортимент рубашек и увеличила оборот. В ее бизнесе появился бухгалтер, который помогает Вите считать и планировать финансовую деятельносить.
texts.en: Vita needs a loan for the purchase of fall merchandise.  She wants to buy women's stockings and warm men's shirts.  Vita used her previous loan to expand her shirt selection and increase turnover.  Her business now includes an accountant, who helps Vita to count and plan financial activities.

loans.use: to purchase fall merchandise

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 53 year old lady blessed with five children, all above the age of 18.  The client operates a boutique in the Kwa Chocha settlement in Malindi town.  She has been in this business for the past ten years now and it gives her a monthly income of about KES 30,000 with which she supports her family. 

This is her first loan term with KADET.  She intends to use the entire loan to expand the business by stocking it with ladies’ make-up, body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves as well as wigs, necklaces, bracelets, and so many other things needed in the business. 

The client wishes to use the anticipated profit from the boutique to support her family financially as well as to continue restocking and gradually expanding the business.  In future, Harriet may come to own her own well established beauty store in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics for her boutique.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en: Naumi is a 44-year-old married lady who sells bananas in Malindi town. This lady has been in business for the past 9 years now and usually earns a monthly income of 2,000 Kenyan shillings. She uses this income to help support her family. This is her fifth loan from the company. She intends to use the entire loan to pay school fees for one of her children, to allow the child to continue learning without any unnecessary interruptions.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Rodrigo es un luchador que siempre ha trabajado con la ilusión de sacara a su familia adelante y ofrecerle un mejor futuro. Desde hace 4 años tiene un negocio que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, una tienda propia que fue una oportunidad para generar mejores ingresos y un posteriormente dejarle a sus 8 hijos un legado para su sostenimiento.

Rodrigo trabaja día a día con gran esmero para que su negocio siga progresando, actualmente ve la necesidad de comprar insumos para surtir la tienda con mas variedad y cantidad, pero no él no cuenta con el capital para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual comprar el surtido, mejorar las ventas, generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida notablemente.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Rodrigo is a fighter who always works with the intention of moving his family forward and offering them a better future. For the past four years, he has managed a business that has given him great satisfaction. Rodrigo has his own store, which gives him the opportunity to generate better income and provide an eventual inheritance for his eight children from which they can support themselves.

Rodrigo works day after day with great effort so that his business can keep progressing. At the moment, he needs to buy supplies to restock his store so that it will have more variety and greater quantity. However, he does not have the capital to invest in his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy inventory, improve his sales, generate more income, and improve his quality of life significantly.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. Trinidad es una persona muy trabajadora la  cual  labora   en una maquiladora  de  la  ciudad , esto  le  permitió  adquirir  su  vivienda   pero  debido  a  el descuento  realizado  para  el  pago de  su casa   se  vio en la necesidad  de autoemplearse  dedicándose  a la   venta de  productos  naturista en  el   cual  le   a   ido  favorablemente   y le   a permitido  seguir adelante   día  con día,  es  por  ello  que  en este  momento   ella  requiere  realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía para  tener  los productos  disponibles  para  sus  clientes   ya  que  ella se  preocupa  por  brindarles  el  excelente  servicio  que  la  a caracterizado.
texts.en:
Sra. Trinidad is a hardworking individual who is employed at a factory in the city. This allowed her to acquire a home because her house payments can be deducted from her paycheck. She also saw the need to become self-employed, so she decided to sell natural products and has achieved favorable results. This has enabled her to move forward each day.

For this reason, Trinidad needs to buy merchandise so that she can have products at her disposal to sell to her customers. She is concerned with providing the excellent service for which she is known.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Kachena B Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of Kachena B group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
	
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

John takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre fund in order to get money, to educate his children and to buy livestock .In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on a half acre piece of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on a half acre of land.

With the income from maize sales, John intends to buy livestock and to get food for his family.

In 2012, members of Kachena B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, John and his group members are displaying some maize cobs from the recent harvest.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a private entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She owns a women’s footwear sales business in one of the local marketplaces called “Yubileinyi.” Zhanna has her own loyal clientele and has been in this trade for seven years. Presently, she has about 30,000 UAH in inventory. This past summer, Zhanna was able to take a month off and go to the sea on vacation. The most difficult part was finding a trustworthy salesperson to fill in for her for one month but Zhanna accomplished this. Now she has more strength and is ready to continue her business further.

Zhanna is requesting a 10,200 UAH loan to increase her assortment of seasonal footwear. Merchandise is getting more expensive and Zhanna needs additional money for her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal footwear

loans.name: Ricardo Salomon

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo tiene 46 años y es soltero. Sus padres son los pioneros en la fabricación de arpas y guitarras  la ciudad. Fue así que desde pequeño tuvo conocimiento en el rubro mediante la ayuda de sus padres, ya que ellos le inculcaron como hacer esos hermosos instrumentos.
Hace aproximadamente 10 años abrió su propio local de ventas. En adelante quiere seguir ampliando su stock para así poder tener mayor clientela y también ganancias. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo y dedicación logra generar los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas y clavijos, los cuales son los materiales esenciales para la fabricación de los instrumentos que vende. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 46 years old and single. His parents are pioneers in the manufacture of harps and guitars in the city of Luque, Paraguay. He was instructed  from childhood in the business by his parents, who taught him how to make these beautiful instruments.

Ricardo opened his own retail outlet approximately ten years ago. Looking ahead, he wants to expand his stock in order to attract more customers and increase profits. He says that through his work and dedication he is able to generate the revenue needed to support his family.

The requested loan is intended for the purchase of wood and pins, which are essential materials for the manufacture of these instruments. Ricardo is grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided.  Obtaining a loan will help him a great deal.

loans.use: to buy wood and pegs for musical instruments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 34 years old and is married with two children who are two and 10 years old. He owns a shop where he sells a variety of products such as beans and maize. Athanase has owned his shop for about two years and his business hours are from six in the morning through nine at night every day. He currently employs two people.

Athanase is requesting a Kiva loan via the Vision Finance Company to purchase large quantities of good such as maize and beans. He hopes that, with these additional goods, he will hopefully earn more profits and start saving for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Beatriz fue amante a la música y así descubrió su talento como cantante desde entonces se ha dedicado a cantar como una forma de generar ingresos para su hogar, desde sus comienzos hace 14 años se ha sentido una mujer afortunada por tener un negocio propio el cual le ha permitido estar al pendiente de sus 3 hijos, ya que trabaja sólo fines de semana y eventos especiales.

Hoy a sus 48 años de edad le apasiona su trabajo, por lo cual procura hacerlo con la mayor calidad posible, es este el motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo, ya que debe comprar un micrófono de mejor calidad ya que en los eventos los clientes acostumbran a coger sus herramientas de trabajo y no le dan el mejor uso, ella debe estar constantemente haciéndole mantenimiento a su micrófono y esto cuesta bastante dinero, Beatriz no cuenta con ese capital necesario para comprar el micrófono y pagar el mantenimiento, y espera poder recibir el crédito ya que así podrá asegurar un mejor servicio, sus ingresos se incrementarán y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida mejorará.
texts.en:
Ever since she was very young, Beatriz has been a music lover and that is how she discovered her talent as a singer. Since then, she has been singing as a way of getting an income for her home. Since she first started, 14 years ago, she has felt like a very fortunate woman for having her own business. Her business allows her to devote herself to her three children, because she works only on weekends and special events.
Today, at the age of 48, she is passionate about her work, which is why she strives to perform with the highest possible quality. That is the reason why she requests a loan, since she must purchase a microphone of better quality, because during events, her customers are used to taking her work instruments and not giving them the best use. She has to constantly do maintenance on her microphone and that costs a lot of money. Beatriz does not have the capital that is necessary to purchase the microphone and pay for its maintenance. She hopes to get the loan because that way she will ensure a better service, increase her profits and, in proportion, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a microphone and do maintenance on her work instruments.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo-Tandahota Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBENONKPO-TANDAHOTA est composé de vingt six membres qui se connaissent parce que les membres de ce groupement habitent dans le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Jeanne, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Sévérin. Le couple a sept enfants, dont trois sont à leur charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne et son mari contribuent ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Jeanne n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis longtemps, la vente d'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend du poisson et des condiments de sauce. Jeanne s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO-TANDAHOTA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
Group Gbenonkpo-Tandahota is composed of twenty-six people, who know each other because they reside in the same village and run various income-generating businesses. The group's representative, Jeanne, is raising her hand on the picture. In order to raise their level of activity to better meet consumer demand, this group is requesting ALIDé’s financial support.
Jeanne is 30 years old and is married to a tailor named Séverin. The couple has seven children, three of which are in their care. Some of the children attend school. Jeanne and her husband provide for the family together. Jeanne never went to school.
To provide for herself and for her children, Jeanne has long been in the business of retailing “akassa” in her region; “akassa” is a local food product made mostly from corn starch. She also sells fish and condiments as a side activity. Jeanne gets her supplies in Benin.
In order to strengthen their businesses and to improve their customers’ satisfaction, Jeanne and the other members of group Gbenonkpo-Tandahota are requesting a loan from ALIDé. They ambition to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy corn, fish and condiments for sauces.

loans.name: Sibale Yg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Bridgity is the facilitator of Sibale Youth Group.  She and Sibale group members have been part of One Acre Fund since 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  As with the majority of families in Western Kenya, the members of Sibale Youth Group are maize farmers and depend on maize year round to feed their families and provide income.

Bridgity and her husband Crispinus take care of four children at home. They joined One Acre fund in order to save money to buy livestock and to buy land.  In the recent 2011 season, the family had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on a one-acre piece of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bridgity's family was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 4 acres of land.
	
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Bridgity and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from maize sales, Bridgity intends to buy livestock and to get food for her family.

In 2012, members of the Sibale Youth Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, some children of a Sibale group farmer have joined in the photo and the farmers are holding maize cobs from the recent harvest.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Maria  Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra  Concepción es una persona muy  responsable que se preocupa   día  con día  por  salir  adelante,  actualmente  ella   vive  con  su  hija  la  cual  se  encuentra  muy  contenta  por  que   acaba de adquirir   su  casa es por  ello  que   acudieron  con nosotros   por  que  desean  levantar  las  bardas de la  vivienda a  donde  se  irán  a  vivir   y  ya  no pagaran  renta,  es  por  ello  que  se están agradecidas  por el  apoyo   brindado para  la realización de  su   proyecto  ya  que   ven en el crédito la posibilidad  de  vivir  cómodamente  y  proteger su  domicilio  de la  inseguridad.
texts.en: Concepción is a very responsable person who worries everyday about getting by.  Currently, she lives with her daughter who finds herself very content because she just acquired a house.  It if for this reason she came to us because they want to raise protective walls around the home where they are going to live and where they will longer have to pay rent.  For this, they are grateful for the support provided for the termination of the project since they see that with the loan is the possibility of living comfortably and protecting their residence from insecurity.

loans.use: to construct a protective wall around their home.

loans.name: Juan Cruz

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 44 años, vive con su familia en el recinto "Milpe" de "Los Bancos" un cantón de la provincia de Pichincha. En el territorio cantonal se encuentra un importante recurso natural como es el Bosque Protector "Mindo Nambillo". Una gran superficie del área cantonal se encuentra ocupada de pastizales ya que la principal actividad del cantón es la ganadería, también se realizan cultivos de palmito, caña de azúcar, plátano, naranjilla en pequeñas superficies.

Este hombre se dedica a sembrar naranjilla, una fruta exótica típica del sector. Desde hace 8 años lo hace de manera independiente y nos cuenta que esta actividad la ha realizado toda su vida ya que la aprendió de su familia. También comenta que el trabajo en el campo es duro y ha soportado las inclemencias del clima como las fuertes lluvias y en general los desafíos del campo. Este es su segundo crédito en Fundación Alternativa y le gusta por la agilidad con la que puede obtener recursos económicos para su negocio. El quiere extender su sembrío y para ello necesita comprar plantas y abonos. Un obstáculo es que no es dueño de los terrenos por lo que debe arrendarlos pero está seguro de que produciendo más podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su gran sueño es tener su propio terreno y sabe que con los esfuerzos que ahora realiza podrá estar más cerca de conseguirlo.
texts.en: Juan is a 44 year-old man who lives with his family in the Milpe precinct of Los Bancos, a canton in the province of Pichincha. The area around this canton holds an important natural resource, the "Mindo Nambillo" Protective Forest. A large area of the canton is covered by grasslands, and the principal economic activity there is cattle-raising. People in the canton also farm palm heart, sugarcane, bananas, and naranjillas over smaller areas. This gentleman works planting naranjilla, an exotic fruit that is typical of the region. He has been working independently for eight years, and explains that he learned this type of work from his family and has been doing it his whole life. He also comments that work in the fields is difficult and that he has endured inclement weather, like strong rains, and generally faced the challenges of the countryside. This is his second loan through Fundación Alternativa and he is pleased by the ease with which he has been able to obtain economic resources for his business. He would like to expand his planting and in order to do so, he needs plants and fertilizer. One impediment is that he does not own the land he cultivates, so he has to rent it. Nevertheless, he is sure that producing more will improve his quality of life. His greatest dream is to have his own land, and he knows that his current efforts will bring him closer to achieving that.

loans.use: to buy naranjilla plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена замужем. Она торгует одеждой на одном из небольших рынков города Запорожье. Елена занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Ей нравится продавать женскую одежду. У нее есть постоянные клиенты, которые покупают одежду именно у Елены. Таким клиентам Елена предоставляет хорошие скидки.

Недавно Елена приобрела бытовую технику для кухни. Она смогла это сделать, так как получила дополнительную прибыль за счет кредитных средств.

Елена просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 6,000 гривен на закупку осеннего товара: колготок, верхней одежды. Бизнес цель Елены – расширить бизнес и открыть еще одну торговую точку.
texts.en:
Elena is married. She sells clothes at one of the small markets in the city of Zaporozhye. Elena has been running this business for the last 11 years. She likes selling women's clothes. Elena has steady clients, who especially come to buy clothes only from her. For such clients Elena gives a nice discount. 

Recently, due to additional business profits Elena was able to improve her kitchen. This would not have been possible without the previous loans she received from HOPE. 

Elena is applying for a loan of 6000 griven to purchase fall clothing: nylon tights and warm coats. Elena's current business goal is to expand and open a second store at the market.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal goods - nylon tights and fall coats.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 48 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de cerdos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica esta actividad, Ella dio inicio vendiendo helados y pan fue así que empezó a sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar, fue por medio de su familia que ella aprendió el negocio de la venta y compra de cerdos, pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben la buena calidad de productos que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos. Sueña con seguirle brindando a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 48 years old. Her business is the buying and selling of pigs, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She started by selling ice cream and bread, and in this way she began to cope with household expenses. Through her family she learned the business of buying and selling pigs, so the majority of her clients know about the good quality of her products. The purpose of the loan is to buy pigs. She dreams of continuing to provide necessary income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Mariée, Philomène a 6 enfants à charges. Elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari dans leur propre maison située dans une banlieue à l'Ouest de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Revendeuse, Philomène commercialise des céréales et de l'igname à la devanture de son domicile. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1986 et en maîtrise tous les contours. La cliente s'approvisionne dans les marchés des villages de production des produits. Elle vient de renouveler son 2ème crédit à FINADEV afin d'effectuer des achats en gros pour minimiser à la fois la fréquence et le coût d'approvisionnement, pour la satisfaction des multiples besoins de sa clientèle et  enfin pour maximiser son profit. Le revenus complémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra de mieux prendre soin de ses enfants et de leur offrir un confort plus agréable.
texts.en: Philomène is married and has six dependent children. She lives with her children and husband in their own house located in a western suburb  of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Philomène works as a vendor selling cereals and yams in front of her house. She has been doing this work in 1986 and knows the ropes. She stocks up at the market in the villages where the produce is grown. She just took out her second loan from FINADEV in order to  make wholesale purchases, minimizing both the frequency of her shopping trips and the initial cost of goods, so as to satisfy  diverse needs of her customers and to maximize her profit. The additional revenue generated thanks to this microloan will allow her to  better provide for her children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of cereals

loans.name: Nipashe B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Fred is the facilitator of the Nipashe B group. Fred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. The members of Nipashe B group are all maize farmers, the most common staple crop in Western Kenya.

Fred takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and high quality seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on 1 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Fred was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Fred will invest in raising livestock and savings for the future.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Nipashe B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Picture:
In the picture above, Fred is pictured with his group. Their field officer Tiberius is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María Erlinda se dedica a una pulpería desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Ella comenzó vendiendo golosinas y refrescos con el tiempo de las utilidades que le generaba el negocio siguió invirtiendo para tener un mayor volumen en su inventario. Es por eso solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos, cigarrillos entre otros. Ella sueña con ampliar más su negocio y brindar los productos que necesitan.
texts.en: Maria Erlinda has operated a corner shop for more than 10 years.  She sold snacks and soft drinks at first, then used profits from the business to expand her inventory.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise for the business: everyday food staples, detergents, matches, cigarettes, etc.  She wants to continue expanding the store and provide the products that her customers need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 47 años, es una valerosa madre soltera que cuida de sus 2 menores hijas: Mabelia y Yelit, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Caritá. Su trasquilo rostro es producto de la vida sosegada que lleva en el campo, pues ya tiene 21 años dedicándose a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo logró obtener buenos resultados, pues cuenta con sus propios terrenos agrícolas; en el caserío de Huacas. Donde todos los días desde muy temprano sale a limpiar y fertilizar sus cultivos de papa y arveja, de las cuales son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de anticuchos a base de corazón de oveja; según cuenta vende un promedio de 50 unidades diarias; eso le ayuda a tener un ingreso extra. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios de enfermería de su hija, donde invierte mensualmente. Pero se siente tranquila, ya que hace poco adquirió un auto con lo que hace trasporte público. Sus planes actuales son sembrar en mayores cantidades para poder culminar de pagar su auto. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita” y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente muy contenta; pues le apoyan en el desarrollo de su trabajo. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda, piensa sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en: Yolanda is 47 years old. She is a courageous single mother who cares for her 2 small daughters, Mabelia y Yelit, in her own house located in the hamlet of Carita. Her serene appearance is a product of a quiet life spent in the fields as she has already spent 21 years farming. During this time she has managed to obtain good results as she has her own farmland in the hamlet of Huacas, where every day from early in the morning she weeds and fertilizes her crops of peas and potatoes. She sells these crops at the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. In the afternoons, she sells kebabs made from sheep's heart. According to her, she says that she sells an average of 50 pieces daily which helps her earn an extra income. Her main difficulty is the cost of childcare for her daughter, which she pays every month. However, she feels assured as recently she bought a car which she uses to provide public transport. Her current plans are to plant in greater numbers so she can finish off paying for the car. She belongs to the communal bank “Progreso Carita” and this is her 6th loan with MFP; she feels very happy as they support the development of her work. For this reason, she promises to be prompt with her repayments. Yolanda is thinking of planting potatoes of the "yungay" and "unica" varieties. As she is receiving support, she will invest the money requested to purchase natural fertilizers to spread over her next crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Sirende Yg Group

texts.en:
Augustine is the facilitator of the Sirende Youth Group. Augustine and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Augustine and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Augustine takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access high quality planting inputs. In the recent 2011 season, Augustine had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Augustine was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Augustine will invest in raising livestock and savings for the future.

In 2012, the members of Sirende Youth Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Photograph:
In the picture above, Augustine is pictured with his group. Their field officer Tiberius is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: 2185 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Frorentine is 36 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and fifteen years old. She is the president of a group which is called “Tuzamurane” in the local language. She is the first woman on the right side.

Frorentine owns a business that sells Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and cassava flour. Her business is open from 7am until 7pm every day except on Sundays, and she currently has two people to help her. This is her second successful year in her business. 

Frorentine and her group will use this loan to expand their Irish potato and cassava flour business. With the profits, Frorentine and her team would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children, and Frorentine will be able to buy goat.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 25 años es una mujer joven, pero muy dedicada. Ella vive en concubinato con Williams, su esposo, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Jeferson y Yesenia, a quienes cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita. Desde muy joven le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra; como también a asumir nuevas responsabilidades. Es por eso que aproximadamente 7 años, comenzó a sembrar. En todo este tiempo logró obtener un terreno agrícola que le proporciona 5 bolsas de producción. Sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y habas, los cuales cuida, fertiliza y limpia la maleza constantemente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tener la compañía de su esposo, pues le ayuda en sus labores. Su principal dificultad es poder costear los gastos de la educación de su hija, porque tiene que trasladarla constantemente a la ciudad. Por ello en el futuro desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas que le proporcionen mayor cantidad de productos, también comprarse una casa en la ciudad para poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece por la confianza depositada. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Karina, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “única”, por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales, además de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra, después de la cosecha.
texts.en:
25-year old Karina is young but very dedicated. She lives with her partner Williams with whom she has two children, Jeferson and Yesenia. They live in their own home in the small village of Carita. Even as a young child Karina was taught how to work the land and also how to take on new responsibilities. At the age of 7 years, she began planting seeds. Since then she has managed to obtain productive farming land.

Karina grows mainly peas, potatoes, and beans which she cares for, fertilizes and keeps free of weeds. The part of her job that she most enjoys is working alongside her husband as he helps her in the fields. The most difficult part is affording the educational expenses of her daughter as she constantly has to take her into town. In the future Karina wishes to buy more agricultural land that can yield a greater quantity of produce. She also wants to buy a house in town so that she can provide her children with a good education.

Karina belongs to the Progreso Carita Community Bank. This is her third loan with MFP whom she thanks for the trust they have placed in her. She promises to pay back the money promptly. She is sowing the Unica potato variety and will use the loan money to buy organic fertilizer and two sacks of peas for the next sowing season after this year's harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and two sacks of peas

loans.name: Mwangaza Wg Group

texts.en:
Judith is the facilitator of the Mwangaza Women Group. Judith and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds and other important farming inputs to distribute to Judith and the Mwangaza Women Group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Judith takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to buy livestock and to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had an excellent maize yield, harvesting six bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest two bags on 1/2 acre of land. 

Surplus maize from Judith's good harvest will go towards paying her kid's school fees and investing in a business.  

In 2012, the members of Mwangaza Women Group will each plant maize plots between 1/2 and one acre.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ayidote-Tandahota Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOTE-TANDAHOTA est formé de dix neuf personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même village au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Victorine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Victorine est âgée de 34 ans, et vit au Bénin depuis sa naissance. Victorine est mariée à un couturier du nom de Séverin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Victorine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Victorine mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et de chaussures de façon secondaire. Victorine s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Victorine et les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE-TANDAHOTA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Group Ayidote-Tandahota is composed of nineteen people, who all reside in the same village in Benin. The group's representative, Victorine, is raising her hand on the picture.
Victorine is 34 years old and has lived in Benin since she was born. She is married to a tailor named Séverin. The couple has five children in their care, who all attend school. Victorine never went to school.
To provide for herself and her family, Victorine is in the business of retailing fabrics; she also sells shoes as a side activity. Victorine gets her supplies in Benin.
This is the first time that Victorine and the other members of group Ayidote-Tandahota are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses and to better meet consumer demand.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Blanca se considera una mujer emprendedora, pues desde hace mucho tiempo se ha rebuscado la manera de sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos. Actualmente tiene un negocio de comidas a las afueras de su casa en donde trabaja los fines de semana y alterna este negocio con la confección, pues durante 10 años ha prestado estos servicios a sus vecinos y personas mas allegadas, sin embargo comenzó con el negocio de comidas por sus ingresos cada vez eran mas pocos. 

Blanca sueña con un mejor futuro, con llegar a tener un taller de confección muy reconocido, y con hacer crecer su negocio de comidas, y para ello sabes que debe mejorar algunos aspectos del lugar como las parrillas, las herramientas de cocina, e insumos para la producción de alimentos, sin embargo la suma de dinero es muy alta para ella, por lo que solicita un crédito de inversión para su negocio, así sus productos tendrán mas calidad y sus ventas se incrementarán al igual que sus ingresos.
texts.en:
63-year old Blanca considers herself an enterprising woman, as for a long time now she has managed to get together enough resources to allow her six children to get ahead. She now runs a business selling food outside her home at weekends. As well she has a sewing business providing services to her neighbours and people who live further away. She started the food business as she didn't earn enough  from sewing.

Blanca dreams of a better future where she will have a well-known sewing workshop and an expanding meal business. In order to achieve this, she knows that she has to improve some aspects such as the grill, kitchen tools, and supplies. However, this all costs more than she can afford so she is seeking a loan so that the food she produces will be of higher quality, sales will increase, as will her income.

loans.use: to buy items for her new business selling food

loans.name: Briceida Urania

texts.es: Briceida tiene 64 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este medio de vida, inicio por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos para su hogar, pues ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Es por eso que cada día se esfuerza más para seguir con este negocio. Ella se levanta temprano para empezar sus ventas. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas de vestir para hombres y mujeres, camisetas, camisolas entre otros.
texts.en: Briceida is 64 years old and she has been selling clothes for more than 11 years. She set up this business because she needed to create a source of income for her home as she is responsible for two dependent children. They are the reason why she continually makes the effort to continue with her business, getting up early every day to start making sales. The loan that Briceida is applying for will be used to buy pants, shirts for men and women, T-shirts, tops and other items.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts for men and women, T-shirts, tops and other items.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 24 años; es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo José y su hijo Daniel, de 6 años. En una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Tapo. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura, de eso ya 8 años. En todo este tiempo pudo aprender las técnicas de cultivo como también los conocimientos para poder progresar y salir adelante. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, alverja y habas, los cuales siembra en terrenos de su comunidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder compartir con su esposo las ganas de salir adelante; pues juntos salen a trabajar todos los días en los pastizales. Más le dificulta obtener su propio capital de trabajo, por los gastos que realiza en el alquiler anual de sus terrenos y los estudios de su hijo. Por eso también se dedica a la ganadería con la crianza de sus 40 ovejas y 50 cuyes. Muy pronto cosechará papa y cuenta que después de ello piensa continuar con la siembra del tubérculo; ya que tiene buena demanda. Sus planes son incrementar su ganancia y comprar su propio terreno agrícola, ya que muy pronto recibirá la llegada de su nuevo hijo. Ella está embarazada. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San jerónimo de Queta” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el apoyo que recibe de su asociación le ayuda en la mejora de sus cultivos. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Nelly, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “andina” por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
24-year old Nelly is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband José and their 6-year old son Daniel in a rented house in the village of Tapo. Ever since she was a girl she has worked on the land. In those eight years she was able to learn certain skills such as how to make progress and get ahead. 

Nelly's principal crops are potatoes, peas, and beans which she grows in the fields in her community. What she most enjoys is being able to share with her husband the wish to do well; they go to work together every day in the fields. Her greatest difficulty is obtaining sufficient money to pay for their expenses such as the annual rent for the fields and their son's education. For this reason Nelly also raises 40 sheep and 50 guinea pigs. Soon she will harvest her potato crop and plans to then plant yucca for which there is a high demand. In the future Nelly would like to earn more money so she can buy land of her own as a new baby will be arriving soon. She is pregnant.

Nelly belongs to the San Jerónimo de Queta Community Bank and this is her eighth loan with MFP. She feels she has done well because the support she has received from her Association has helped her improve her crops. For this reason she promises to pay back the money punctually.

She is sowing the Andina potato variety and will use the loan money to buy organic fertilizer to spread on the fields.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Humberto es una persona muy trabajadora, labora en un taller de herrería como soldador, y su apreciable esposa trabaja los fines de semana vendiendo comida rápida  como hamburguesas, burritos y hot dog, para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos ya que cuenta con uno en preparatoria, ellos empezaron por su cuenta a ampliar la planta baja de el frente de su vivienda y su deseo es terminarlo ya que le falta la losa y las ventanas y por eso se acercaron  a la  institución para que los apoyaremos y ver su sueño hecho realidad, agradece el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Humberto is a very hardworking man. He works as a welder in a blacksmith's workshop while his wife provides invaluable support by working on weekends selling take away food such as hamburgers, burritos and hot dogs, which helps her husband with the cost of raising their children, one of whom has just started school. 

The couple would like to enlarge the room which they have built onto the front of their house. They have already started on it but now they would like to finish it by adding stonework and windows, which is why they approached this institution for help. They look forward to seeing their dream made reality and they are grateful for the support offered to them to complete this project.

loans.use: to expand the ground floor of his house

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a una D. las miembros, quien oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya, se informó y quedó encantada con la idea, por lo que organizó y formó a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio. D. allí surge el comité denominado Mujeres Activas, que cuenta con 18 integrantes, las cuales trabajan D. forma conjunta para la consecución D. los objetivos que ellas persiguen. Sus sueños son sacar siempre adelante a su empresa a su familia.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Domiciana, ella se dedica a la venta D. lencería, comenta que tiene muchos clientes y clientas que siempre compran D. ella, hace un tiempo que se dedica a esto por lo que tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Le gustara poder seguir con su negocio, por lo que quiere poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lencerías, tanto masculina como femenina, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed thanks to one of the members.  She heard talk about a program for enterprising women with the Fundación Paraguaya.  She learned about it and was delighted with the idea.  Therefore, she organized and educated her friends and neighbors.  From there the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) Communal Bank emerged.  There are 18 members, and they work together in order to achieve the objectives that they pursue.  Their dreams are always to get their businesses and their families ahead. 

Domiciana is one of the members.  She sells underwear.  She says that she has a lot of customers, and customers always buy from her.  She has been doing this for some time; therefore she now has solid customer base.  She would like to be able to continue her business, and that is why she wants to be able to keep investing in it.

She is requesting the loan to buy underwear, as much for men as women.  With the loan she will be able to fill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy underwear to later sell.

loans.name: Isla Negra Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Isla Negra” lo conforman 18 socios quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía y venta de ropa. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Antonio.
Ana Luisa integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, sentada en el lugar del medio, su cabello es negro y largo, además viste un sweater color gris y sostiene una cartera de color café en las piernas.
Se dedica a vender artesanía desde hace 12 años, sus productos son pinturas, letras, aros, collares y ropa. Ella misma se dedica a la elaboración de productos de artesanía en vidrio y también compra productos a otros artesanos conocidos. Ella vende en una feria artesanal.
Con el crédito comprará vidrio para trabajar en vitrofusión, que es el arte de modelar el vidrio a grandes temperaturas. Además comprará ceniceros, copas de diferentes estilos, vasos de diferentes tamaños, chicos y grandes.
Las metas en su negocio son generar cierta exclusividad con los productos que pueda realizar y que además sean productos de calidad. 
Ana Luisa vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad.
Sus sueños son ampliar el local que atiende en la feria artesanal. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece se ha unido y están cada vez más comprometidos. 
San Antonio es un puerto de la región de Valparaíso, siendo esta una de sus principales características, ubicado en el litoral central de Chile. Se desarrolla en forma importante la pesca y venta de pescados y mariscos. Pese a la actividad portuaria y comercial del puerto, existe un alto índice de cesantía.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Isla Negra" and is made up of 18 members who are involved in many different lines of work, including selling artesanal crafts and clothes. All of them live in the city of San Antonio.

Ana Luisa is a member of this community bank and can be seen in the photo sitting in the middle of the first row. She has long black hair and she is wearing a grey jumper and holding a brown bag on her lap. She has been selling artesanal crafts including paintings, letters, earrings, necklaces and clothing for twelve years. She makes her own artesanal products out of glass and also purchases products from other well-known artisans, going on to sell these products at the artesanal fair.

With this loan Ana Luisa will purchase glass so she can work in the glass fusion style, which is the art of styling glass at high temperatures. She will also buy ashtrays, cups in various styles and vases in different sizes, both large and small. Her business goals are to sell her artesanal works exclusively, and to create quality products. 

Ana Luisa lives with her husband and her two children who are 17 and 12 years of age. Her dream is to expand the market stall that she operates at the artesanal fair. Ana Luisa is very happy and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business and generate larger profits. She says that the community bank that she belongs to is very united and the group is becoming more and more committed to each other. 

San Antonio is one of the main traditional port towns in the Valparaíso region and is located on the central coast of Chile. It has become a very important town for fishing and selling fish and seafood. Because of the commercial activity on the dock of the port, there is also a high unemployment rate.

loans.use: to purchase glass, ashtrays, cups in various styles and vases in different sizes, both large and small.

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es: William Antonio tiene 31 años, su actividad es el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio. Lo inicio con esfuerzo propio, ya que él había aprendido este oficio fue con el paso del tiempo que logro obtener sus propios clientes. William realiza un buen trabajo con cada uno de sus productos. Él solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, pega, maque entre otros
texts.en: William Antonio, 31, owns a carpentry business.  He has operated the business for more than 13 years.  He learned everything he needed to know about carpentry, gradually built a customer base over the years and started the business with his own funds.  William fills every order with great care.  He is applying for a loan to buy wood, nails, glue, maque, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rental furniture.

loans.name: Kabero Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the Kabero group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Martin takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½  acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children, ensure food security, raise livestock and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Kabero group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Milcerio

texts.es: Milcerio tiene 47 años, es un hombre muy sensible y responsable. Vive con su esposa Amanda; que es su compañera desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Queta. La siembra y cosecha de papas es la actividad al que se dedica desde hace 30 años. Cuenta que antes de ir a sus terrenos, alimenta a sus burros y caballos que son muy útiles para transportar los sacos durante la cosecha, además de las 25 ovejas que tiene. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, olluco, arveja y habas, que produce las 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola; el cual vende al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le molesta es ver que sus siembras han quedado en la tierra debido al hielo y otros como la gusanera. Pero eso no lo desanima, al contrario le brinda fuerzas para continuar. Pronto cosechará papa de la variedad “andina” y está seguro que tendrá buenos resultados; además lo motiva la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes son buenos y trabajadores; pues todavía estudian. Él pertenece al banco comunal “San Jerónimo de Queta” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde demostró mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la misma dinámica de pago. Milcerio, tiene pensado sembrar papa de la variedad “andina” y “amarilis” por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlo en su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Milcerio, 47, is a clear-headed and responsible man.  He lives with his wife, Amanda, his companion for 25 years.  They have 5 children together, 4 of whom still live at home.  They live in a house they own in the small town of Queta.  Milcerio is a farmer, work that he's done for 30 years.  He tells us that before he heads out to his fields, he feeds his donkeys and horses--useful for carrying heavy loads at harvest time--and the 25 head of sheep that he owns.  He grows potatoes, olluco, beans and peas on 5 hectares of land and sells what he harvests at the Tarma wholesale market.  What most bothers him are the plants that he loses to frost and worms.  He doesn't dwell on the problems that he faces, though, choosing instead to fight and overcome them.  He will soon harvest a crop of Andean-variety potatoes and he's sure that he'll be happy with the results.  He's driven to work in part for his children, all of whom are good, hard-working young men and women and still in school.  Milcerio belongs to the San Jeronimo de Queta community bank and this is his eighth MFP loan.  He's paid past loans on time and is committed to repaying this one in the same responsible way.  Milcerio will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his next crop of "Andeans" and "yellows".

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es: Walberto es un joven emprendedor de 22 años; vive en la casa propia de sus padres. Cuenta que comparte cuarto con su hermanos menores: Ronaldiño y Liz; aunque es muy joven se ha propuesto en apoyar  y ayudar en los gasto del hogar; ya que tiene varios hermanos. Desde niño apoyo en los trabajo agrícolas. Es por eso que desde los 15 años adquirió 3 hectáreas de terreno, donde siembra alverja, papa, olluco y habas. Su principal dificultad son sus hermanos pequeños que tiene muchas limitaciones, por eso decidió trabajar con esmero. Cada vez que tiene tiempo disfruta mucho del campo, ya que también trabaja como transportista, cubriendo la ruta Huaricolca – Acobamba, que es un lugar turístico; según cuenta obtiene una ganancia de S/. 50 soles diarios. Eso le ayuda en sus ingresos, además de comercializar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ahora tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “andina” y alverja en gran cantidad; asegura obtendrá buenas ganancias en la cosecha que será dentro de pocos días. Su mayor aspiración es poder estudiar una carrera universitaria. Él pertenece al banco comunal “San Jerónimo de Queta” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde es un cliente muy gracioso e ingenio, que arranca la sonrisa a los demás integrantes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Walberto, sembrará papa de la variedad “andina” por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próximo cultivo.
texts.en: Walberto is a young entrepreneur, age 22, who lives with his parents in their own home.  He shares his room with his younger brothers: Ronaldiño and Liz.  Although he is very young he wants to support and help with the household expenses since he has several siblings.  Ever since he was a boy he has helped in the agricultural work.  When he was 15 he acquired three hectares of land where he grows peas, potatoes, olluco (a root vegetable) and lima beans.  The main difficulty he has are the limitations of his small brothers, so he decided to work hard himself.  Whenever he has time he enjoys going to the country because he also works as a transport driver and covers the route between Huaricolca - Acobamba which is a tourist spot.  He makes about 50 PEN a day.  This helps with his income.  He also sells his crops at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  He is now growing the "andina" potato variety and large volumes of peas.  He is sure he'll get a good profit from the harvest in a few days.  His greatest goal is to study a university degree.  He belongs to the communal bank "San Jerónimo de Queta" and this is his seventh loan through MFP.  He is a gracious and ingenious member who always makes the other members laugh.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy natural fertilizer for the next planting season.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: El apreciable Sr. Concepción, tiene su negocio de vulcanizadora en su vivienda desde hace ya mas de quince  años, y a la vez para reforzar su economía familiar trabaja en una constructora como albañil esto para darle un mejor calidad de vida a su distinguida esposa, el esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar herramienta nueva  para   seguir   realizando  sus  trabajos  en  su negocio y  continuar  brindando  a  sus   clientes  el excelente  servicio  que  le  a  caracterizado.
texts.en: The honorable Mr. Concepción has his own vulcanizing business which he set up in his house over fifteen years ago.  Also, in order to strenthen the family economy, he works as a bricklayer with a construction company so he can give his distinguished wife a better lifestyle.  The loan he is requesting is to buy a new tool for his work so he can continue providng the excellent service to customers he is known for.

loans.use: To buy a .

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
A sus 21 años de edad Mary Luz es una luchadora incansable, que trabaja con la ilusión de brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo de 11 meses, y para su fortuna cuenta con el apoyo de su familia que le han ayudado mucho a sacar su negocio adelante, trabaja diariamente en la producción y venta de buñuelos y aunque no son muchas las ganancia Mary Luz sueña con llegar a tener un gran negocio que sea reconocido por sus clientes y allegados.

Actualmente Mary Luz necesita un préstamo para invertirle a su negocio, comprar insumos como harina, queso, aceite, huevos y otros con los cuales se hacen los buñuelos, pues comprando en mayores cantidades las utilidades serán mejores y sus ingresos se incrementaran, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su bebe.
texts.en:
At the age of 21, Mary Luz is an indefatigable fighter who works cheerfully to provide a better future for her 11-month-old son.  Luckily, she has her parents' support since they help her with the business.  She works every day making and selling "buñuelos" (doughnuts), and even though her earnings aren't high Mary Luz dreams about having a great business that is recognized by customers and acquaintances.

Mary Luz is currently in need of a loan to invest in her business.  She needs to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, oil, eggs and other items to make the buñuelos.  If she buys larger volumes she can cut costs and increase her income, which will improve her baby's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "buñuelos" (doughnuts).

loans.name: Mopepe Ya Sika Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of the community bank named “Mopepe ya Sika Plus” which means "new wind" in English. This group is made up of twenty-eight members firmly united to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Marie’s main business is selling cassava and corn flour in her area, located to the west of Kinshasa. Since 2000, she has been in the micro-business world. She has acquired solid experience in this area, works hard, and has good management skills, which will help her achieve her dream of one day becoming a food-trade woman. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business which earns her $30 per week. 

Marie is happy to be among DRC HOPE’s clients. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying some sacks of cassava and corn flour and reselling them for a profit. At fifty-three years old, Marie is married and has eight children between eighteen and thirty-three years old. One of them goes to school.

loans.use: to reinforce the working capital by purchasing some sacks of cassava and corn flour and reselling them at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre de 43 años, vive con su familia. Tiene un hijo de 20 años quien actualmente está en la universidad. Reside y trabaja en la parroquia "Chiguilpe" de la cabecera cantonal de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas". Este sector se encuentra en la zona urbana y goza de un clima cálido. 

Gustavo es sastre desde hace 15 años. Trabaja más de diez horas al día atendiendo a su clientela con quien se esmera en cada obra. Ha pensado en comprar telas para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y así mejorar la atención que tiene en su sastrería. Este es su tercer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, le gusta la forma de pago que aquí obtiene y que con estos créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio y con ello sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

En una ocasión él sufrió de una enfermedad y pese a ello tuvo que seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia y cuidando de ella. Hoy quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y por ello pondrá todo su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 43 and lives with his family.  He has a 20-year-old son who studies at the university.  He lives and works in the "Chiguilpe" parish of the cantonal head of the province of "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas".  This sector is in an urban area and has a mild climate.

Gustavo has been a tailor for 15 years.  He works more than ten hours a day attending to customers, each of whom receives special care.  He wants to buy fabric to offer a wider variety to his customers and improve his shop's service.  This is his third loan through the Fundación Alternativa.  He likes the payment terms he gets here.  With the loans he has been able to improve his business, income and quality of life.

Once he fell ill but was able to keep working to support and care for his family.  Now he wants to improve his lifestyle and will work hard to do so.

loans.use: To buy fabric for his tailor shop.

loans.name: Gloria Altamirano

texts.es: Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos básicos. Este negocio lo inicio con un dinero que tenía ahorrado, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como maestra. Fue con el paso del tiempo que ella logro agrandar su actividad  y con la ayuda de los financiamientos.  Ella tiene su negocio en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen la amplia variedad de productos que ofrece. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, sandalias, bolsos, prendas, perfumes, pintura, entre otros.
texts.en: Gloria sells clothing and basic products.  She began her business with money she saved since she used to work as a teacher.  Over a period of time she was able to expand her activity through the help of loans.  Her shop is set up inside her home and most of her customers are familiar with the wide variety of products she offers.  The loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, sandals, bags, garments, perfumes, paint and other items.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, sandals, bags, garments, paint and other items.

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es: Evelyn Carolina: de 29 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias desde hace varios años ella nos cuenta que en esta fecha son muy especiales en el pueblo y es cuando ella tiene muchos pedidos en el pueblo de sus clientes es asi como ella logra ayudar a sus padres y desea seguir ayudando por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de variedades en sandalias y estilos,el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y seguir ayudando a su padres.
texts.en: Evelyn Carolina, who is 29 year old, has made her living selling sandals for a number of years.  She tells us that at this time they are in high demand in her town, which is when she has a lot of orders from her customers.  This is how she is able to help out her parents.  She hopes to continue helping them, which is why she is requesting the loan: to purchase a variety of sandal styles.  Her dream is to have a larger store and to continue helping her parents.

loans.use: to purchase sandals in a variety of styles.

loans.name: Segundo Jasmany

texts.es:
Segundo Jasmany tiene 28 años, es Soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y poder adquirir los abonos , fertilizantes, urea para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. 

Su sueño es salir adelante y tener un negocio propio para no depender de ninguna otra persona..

En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Segundo Jasmany is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. He does not have any children. 

The SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS communal bank is located in Amarillos, in the Ventanas canton. 
The members of this communal bank work in farming with short-cycle crops like corn and rice. 

Segundo farms corn and rice. He buys his products at the Murillo market and he sells his crops at the same market. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and different types of fertilizers for his crops.  The help from the loan would help him economically so he can take care of his needs. He faces challenges in his work like plagues, diseases and the variations in the climate. 

His dream is to get ahead and to have his own business so he does not have to depend on anyone else.

In his free time, he likes to play sports and especially he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: buy seeds and different types of fertilizers.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en su propia casa donde reina la armonía. Desde muy niña trabajaba en los campos de cultivo de sus padres. Luego de un tiempo, logró ahorrar y lo junto con la herencia que recbiera de su papá, hoy es propietaria de 03 hectáreas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco. En ella, ha arado y fertilizado, para cultivar cacao, café y raíces de barbasco, productos que luego son comercializados al por mayor en los centros de acopio en la ciudad de San Francisco y Santa Rosa. Éstos productos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir con los gastos familiares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales (lugar donde seca los granos) que se encuentran en su comunidad. Por tal razón debe contratar jornaleros que la apoyen con esta labor tan pesada.  Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP y espera de una pequeña ayuda para cumplir con sus objetivos, asimismo se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is from the city of Santa Rosa. She is 47, married and has three children at school. They live peacefully together in their own house. Since she was a very little girl, Alejandra worked in her parents' fields. After some time, she managed to save some money and put it together with the inheritence she received from her father to buy 3 hectares of land, which she works very hard. She has ploughed and fertilised the fields in order to grow cacao, coffee and barbasco root, products which are then sold wholesale in distribution centres in the cities of San Francisco and Santa Rosa.

These products have given Alejandra the necessary income to keep up with the household expenses. What she likes most about her job is caring for the crops, as she feels happy doing it. She has been doing this for 15 years and would say that the most difficult part is transporting the products from the farm to the area where they dry the grains, which is located in the town. For that reason she has to employ farmhands who help her with this heavy work. In the future, she would like to buy new land to grow more crops.

This will be Alejandra's 6th loan with MFP and she is asking for a little help so she can achieve her goals. For her part, she promises once more to keep up with her repayments. She is grateful for being part of her communal bank as all the members are responsible people. With the money she has requested, she will buy more cacao plants and graft them so that they will bear fruit more quickly.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 6 años. Mercedes tiene un triciclo donde vende verduras y frutas que reparte por todo sitio, recuerda que con su primer crédito que obtuvo compró pocas frutas, porque tenia su triciclo, pero poca mercadería, gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido ha podido progresar su negocio. Lo que mas agradece es que pudo educar a sus hijos, además pudo construir su casita en Pomabamba. Ahora este préstamo lo utilizara para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio, va a comprar mas verduras y frutas.
A Mercedes le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal, porque le ayudaron a poder invertir bien, aprendió a ahorrar, y ahora ya se le hizo una costumbre. Su meta es poder ahorrar mas para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella ["Star"] Communal Bank.  She is 44 and has 3 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for six years. Mercedes has a tricycle which she uses to sell fruits and vegetables throughout the region. She tells us that she used her first loan to buy some fruits because she had her tricycle but very little merchandise. Thanks to the loans that she has received, she has been able to improve her business. She is most grateful for having been able to educate her children. She was also able to start building her home in Pomabamba. Now, she will use this loan in order to keep stocking her business. She will buy more vegetables and fruits.
Mercedes enjoys the training that she gets in her Communal Bank, because it helps her to know how to invest well. She has learned to save, and now it is a habit. Her goal is to be able to save more to build her home.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Santa Lucia se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, todas interesadas en mejorar su vida personal y familiar. Desean darle a sus familias un mejor estilo de vida, ya que no quieren que sus hijos pasen por las mismas necesidades que ellas. Las integrantes son personas humildes que formaron un grupo para que puedan luchar hombro con hombro para lograr los objetivos propuestos  y trabajar conjuntamente con actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora  Mercedes, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, con lo cual puede mantener su casa y paliar los gastos diarios. Además de eso comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes, como así también pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y queso, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Santa Lucia" was formed by the union of a number of neighbors and friends from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of them were interested in improving their personal and their family lives.  They hope to give their families a better quality of life, since they don't want their children to go through the same need that they themselves experienced.  The members are modest women who formed a group to be able to work shoulder to shoulder to achieve their proposed objectives and to be able to work jointly on activities that will strengthen their friendships.
One of the members is Señora  Mercedes.  She makes her living selling cheese and milk, with which she is able to support her household and meet her daily expenses.  In addition, she states that she always has a lot of customers and orders.  
Señora  Mercedes is requesting the loan to purchase milk and cheese, with which she will be able to stock up to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and milk for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou habite dans la region sud senegal ,depuis 5 ans,elle fait de la coiffure dans son propre salon.Mariée depuis 2005 sans enfant,avec son metier ,elle arrive a soutenir sa mere pere,avec se credit elle veut  acheter de nouveaux produits pour augmenter son stocks et ainsi developper son activitesalon. Elle travaille avec trois de ses apprenties et avec ses benefice elle pense acheter un terrain dans le futur.
texts.en: Fatou lives in southern Senegal. She is a hairdresser and has had her own salon for 5 years. She has been married since 2005 and has no children.
